This year, as part of my M3 Community Project, "Help Children With Cancer," I am aiming to raise awareness about children's cancer in Bermuda. I will be raising money for the Bermuda Cancer and Health Centre, so that the children with cancer can be treated here in Bermuda, instead of overseas.

story:
- About Me -

My name is Ria Kuroki. I have been practicing yoga for 8 years and teaching what I have found on my mat for last 4 years in America. I truly feel that yoga is my foundation to learn how to observe my thoughts and redirect my action towards a better self. 

Few years ago, I started questioning "How can I spread this amazing wisdom, yoga, to more people?" Then, an opportunity presented itself to me last year. I inherited my grandparent's farming land in Kagoshima, Southern Japan. I immediately thought "I want to use this abandoned land to bring people together so that our collective energy can regenerate the land and we are able to experience what is like to live more self sustainable and loving ways!" And to me, that's the wisdom of yoga - creating unity within and beyond of ourselves. 

I am anxious to launch a project that is something bigger than myself, but I believe that anything is possible when we have a right vision, mindset, willingness and support to enjoy every step of this journey! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need YOU the most!

Even if I had millions of dollars to build a sustainable destination place, that is not what I want. I want to include you to build the place together so we can experience every step and share the joy along the journey. I want a world wide community to spread the knowledge you will learn at Kansha Farm to pass on to your loved ones and future generations. No special skills are necessary to join this project. Your excitement, willingness, ideas, and any experiences in your life will start creating a place where we can get together to be more alive. 

  • 2018, I will offer 7 day gratitude, Kansha, retreat hosting 36 people in 3 months (July to October). 4 people maximum per retreat. *We will create groups according to your traveling dates.
  • $400 will cover your accommodation, 3 daily meals and nearby airport transportation for the retreat.

All the funding goes to necessary start up fees such as housing, transportation, local tour, food and promotion.

 

The Impact

This is not going to be an usual unplug and escape type of retreat. This is going to be more of a place where people will be actively searching, experiencing  and shearing ways of minimal but rich lifestyle. So any of your contribution matters to enrich one's life and also the earth as well. The more people start living towards sustainable ways possible, the better the earth will be. The impact you make comes right back to you.

 

Why Crowdfunding?

Why did I choose a crowdfund platform? - because I am not offering business here. I don’t have a budget or investors to set up everything to run a business and I’m glad that is the way. I want everyone to get involved to create a farm so WE can say WE built something significant together. You contribute your energy to this farm that eventually leads to an amazing worldwide community (in my dream now) and I want to be a part to hold the root!

 

Risks & Challenges

My challenge is to get you at my farm. You don't know me. I don't imagine people will be so excited to book a flight to get to half way around the world and stay at a stranger's house! If you do, I think you are kinda crazy...! So I somehow need to come up with a plan to make myself available to you so that you can sort of trust me or get a sense of who I am.

  • I am offering a yoga class with my raw vegan chocolate,

Promoting Kansha Farm project in London , UK   Feb 17, 2018

If you can invite me to any yoga studios or really any place that I can host a yoga class, I will try my best to be there! Availability is from 2/25 to 3/19 in 2018 for the United States.  

You can reach me at riakurokiyoga@gmail.com for any questions. ​​

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may simply not be into yoga, farming or traveling. But you still might want to contribute. There are so many ways that you can help to get this project going.

  • You can reach out to your friends who might be interested about this project. This is a big contribution! You don't realize how big of impact this will be!
  • You may tell your yoga studio that you love to invite me. 
  •  Follow me on my social media to be updated and share the info!

I basically want you to share everything about this project to anyone who might be interested! It doesn't matter where you live, what you do, who you are! Let's do this together!

 

 

7 Day Kansha Retreat Sample Plan

(6 Nights / 7 Days)

Day1:  Arrival. Meet and Greet.

Day2: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Local Traditional Cooking Experience. Dinner

Day3: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Soba making. Dinner.

Day4: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Visiting Kirishima Shrine. Dinner. 

Day5: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Local Tea Roasting/ Blending Workshop. Onsen Experience. Dinner

Day6: Free day to explore the city/ neighboring cities. 

Day7: Departure. 

 

Accommodation:

Japanese house - shared rooms and shared bath.  

 

 

Instagram: Yogischocolate  https://www.instagram.com/yogischocolate/

Facebook: Ria Kuroki  https://www.facebook.com/riakuroki

Website: Yogis Chocolate  yogischocolate.com

Youtube: Kansha Farm  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1kSa6WCdoM1aK...

Email: riakurokiyoga@gmail.com

If you can invite me to any yoga studios or really any place that I can host a yoga class, I will try my best to be there! Availability is from 2/25 to 3/19 in 2018 for the United States.  
You can reach me at riakurokiyoga@gmail.com for any questions. ​​
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people may simply not be into yoga, farming or traveling. But you still might want to contribute. There are so many ways that you can help to get this project going.


You can reach out to your friends who might be interested about this project. This is a big contribution! You don't realize how big of impact this will be!
You may tell your yoga studio that you love to invite me. 
 Follow me on my social media to be updated and share the info!

I basically want you to share everything about this project to anyone who might be interested! It doesn't matter where you live, what you do, who you are! Let's do this together!
 
 
7 Day Kansha Retreat Sample Plan
(6 Nights / 7 Days)
Day1:  Arrival. Meet and Greet.
Day2: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Local Traditional Cooking Experience. Dinner
Day3: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Soba making. Dinner.
Day4: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Visiting Kirishima Shrine. Dinner. 
Day5: Yoga. Breakfast. Farm Building Experience. Lunch. Free Time. Local Tea Roasting/ Blending Workshop. Onsen Experience. Dinner
Day6: Free day to explore the city/ neighboring cities. 
Day7: Departure. 
 
Accommodation:
Japanese house - shared rooms and shared bath.  
 

 
Instagram: Yogischocolate  https://www.instagram.com/yogischocolate/
Facebook: Ria Kuroki  https://www.facebook.com/riakuroki
Website: Yogis Chocolate  yogischocolate.com
Youtube: Kansha Farm  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1kSa6WCdoM1aK...
Email: riakurokiyoga@gmail.com

story:
Silence Finder can take you into deep states of meditation.  The carefully selected meditations will allow you to find inner peace, to erase old patterns of conditioning and to redesign your life. They are free of dogma or any religious belief,

Silence Finder will connect you to people who meditate in your neighborhood and around the world.

Silence Finder will show you silent places in nature and cities, where you can recharge your batteries by connecting to the spirit of the earth and the cosmos.

We feel its time for a change in global consciousness by connecting people who meditate. We have experienced that silence is the ground from which a new way of connecting to each other will emerge. When silence becomes the common ground of consciousness the deeper truth of connectedness will reveal itself. 




Harvard conducted research that shows: daily meditation can literally grow the gray matter in key areas of your brain.

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-11-22/harvard-yoga-scientists-find-proof-of-meditation-benefit.html

Insead:

http://www.insead.edu/media_relations/press_release/2014_insead_wharton_meditation.cfm


We at Silence Finder want to contribute to the global change of consciousness through meditation techniques, which are not bound by any religion or organisation. Decades of meditative practices in various traditions brought us together to share those techniques, which lift people’s consciousness without the necessity to believe in anything. We trust in pure meditative experience as the highest form of spirituality. Thus we collected the most effective methods from many spiritual traditions in this app, backed up by neuroscience research.

We at Silence Finder want to connect people who meditate and share the same vision of a better planet through making the next step in consciousness: From Ego or Ethnocentric to Global Consciousness. In many years of meditation we have experienced the natural falling away of ego-centered behaviour and found ourselves waking up to a much deeper truth. When you create space in your consciousness and empty out old patterns of conditioning, the deeper truth of connectedness reveals itself. Therefore our intent is to connect people who meditate worldwide. When you are in sync with everything around you, you might also want to connect with people who share the same level of consciousness.

We at Silence Finder discovered that silent places around the planet can help significantly to deepen our meditative experience. They naturally lift our consciousness with no effort and can put us into a deep state of meditation. By sharing these places via the silence finder app, we will be able to meet people like us, who are lovers of the spirit of silence.




The app covers the major issues, such as how to deal effectively with sleep deprivation, fears and worries, goal setting, and how to find guidance and clarity in one`s own intuition. Silence Finder has been developed from 25 years of stress-management workshops with all kinds of human beings on how to effectively reduce stress and deal with increasing complexity.


Studies have shown that excessive levels of stress leads to poor decision-making affecting employees' and managers' abilities to respond appropriately to important tasks. Chronic stress weakens cognitive skills and performance, and creates low levels of organisational commitment. When stress invades the workplace, individuals develop a sense of fear and anxiety. This affects motivation, judgment, planning, moral reasoning, and health.


We invested in the last months countless of hours and our private money into this project and we realized, that with a little bit of support, we can create something really big.

This is why we ask for your support. All the money will be used to:

  1. Create new languages: Chinese, Spanish, French, Arabic, Russian, Portuguese
  2. Building an infrastructure for a worldwide community
  3. Hire talented meditation practitioners with a strong wish to make this a global success story.
  4. Fund our worldwide social media activities
  5. Enhance the current app with some additional functionalities

100.000 USD 
  1. We will hire our first staff to focus on the marketing side ( we have already conducted the interviews and got her ok to join our company.
  2. We will invest in the infrastructure
  3. We will create the app in Chinese, Spanish and French
200.000 USD
  1. We will invest in our global reach
  2. We will produce the app in Arabic, Russian and Portuguese
  3. We will produce a Windows Phone Version of the App
  4. Create an online library of meditation techniques and scientific research
300.000 - ?
We will hire additional staff to support our team. We will work on additional meditations. We will work on the infrastructure.
We will come back with more ideas as soon as we reach these goals.
This is how you can support us. Thank you!


Questions? Please send us an email - we will be in touch: social@silencefinder.com

Thank you very much!

Andreas & Ralph ( Founders )

story:
Short Summary

The Beyond the Diagnosis Art Exhibit's focus is on children living with a rare disease. Artists have donated their time and talents to paint rare disease patients for this groundbreaking Exhibit. This beautiful Exhibit will travel to medical schools and hospitals across the country encouraging the medical community to look "beyond the diagnosis" to the patient. With an average diagnosis time of 8 years and few treatment options, doctors and rare disease patients need to have a more engaged approach to reduce diagnosis time and improve care. There are 15 million children suffering and dying from a rare disease in the United States. Very few have treatment, there are NO cures. One of the greatest barriers to quality of life for these children and their families is the years of torment and confusion as they wait for a correct diagnosis. Art has been used for thousands of years to successfully convey a message, whether it be a story or a glimpse into the human spirit. At Rare Disease United Foundation we believe that art not only leaves a lasting impression, but creates a unique connection for the viewer. Rare disease patients will benefit greatly from the powerful impression the Beyond the Diagnosis Art Exhibit will leave on the medical community. Please consider helping us spread the story to the people we need to see us most, the medical community. This stunning Exhibit is unforgettable. Please visit our photo gallery to see pictures of the children!


What We Need & What You Get

All of the art work was donated! This Exhibit is not a fundraiser. It is a teaching tool for medical students to see beyond the patient to the human, to the child. We need money to cover the costs of photographing the portraits, having them framed, getting them shipped and the cost of the beautiful catalogue.

The Impact

Our Beyond the Diagnosis Art Exhibit was unveiled at Brown University's Alpert Medical School for the entire month of February 2015 in honor of World Rare Disease Day.

The Exhibit, in one month at one school, reached well over 100,000 people. Brown University covered it in their monthly newsletter which reached 90,000 people. The Exhibit was covered by a local news station, an article about the Exhibit was featured in the Rhode Journal of Medicine and NBC.com did a piece on the Exhibit. One school! One month! 

The Beyond the Diagnosis Art Exhibit is honored to raise awareness of the following rare diseases:

● Undiagnosed Diseases                                     ● Gaucher

● Williams Syndrome                                           ● Apert Syndrome

● Osteogenesis Imperfecta                               ● Nonketotic Hyperglycinemia

● Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy                   ● Sanfilippo Syndrome

● Sandhoff Syndrome                                         ● Epidermolysis Bullosa

● Ectodermal Dysplasia                                     ● Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome

● 18q-                                                                        ● Angelman Syndrome

●Moebius Syndrome                                           ● Timothy Syndrome

● Rett Syndrome                                                  ● Sturge-Weber

● XIAP Deficiency                                                 ● Eosinophilic Esophagitis

● NGLY1                                                                   ● Glutaric Aciduria

● Prader-Willi Syndrome                                   ● Usher Syndrome

● aHUS                                                                    ● Stickler Syndrome

● DEND Syndrome                                             ● Harlequin Ichthyosis

● Hunter Syndrome                                           ● Achondroplasia Dwarfism

●Batten Syndrome                                            ● Blue Rubber Bleb Nevus

● Pompe                                                                ● Incontinetia Pigmenti

● Tay Sachs                                                          ● Phenylketonuria

and with your help this list will keep growing!!!!

Artists from around the world are now participating. Artist who already contributed once choose to give again. Our original hope was a small Exhibit traveling the country. Beyond the Diagnosis I had 17 pieces. Beyond the Diagnosis II has 43 pieces representing 43 different rare diseases and is headed to Harvard Medical School in November. I believe in the power of art and I believe this exhibit will change everything for people living rare across the globe. Having a child with a rare disease is devastating. Unimaginable. We don't fight for a cure. We fight for a treatment. This project bring us joy and hope for a future where our children are not less. 


We are so grateful to the artists who put everything into these portraits. No one has shown us such kindness and generosity. Rare Loves Artists!



Other Ways You Can Help

If you are an artist and are interested in participating, please let us know. Thank you.

Vidéo Version Française (con subtitulos en español) en dessous de la video ou sur ce lien :

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cdU1DtXPhH4


ENGLISH TEXT BELOW - TEXTE EN FRANCAIS EN DESSOUS - TEXTO EN ESPAÑOL ABAJO

The gifts/perks are NOT representative of the price of future stays at the lodge. They are simply “thank you” gifts you’ll receive by supporting the project with a donation!
Les cadeaux ne sont PAS représentatifs des coûts des futurs séjours au Lodge, ce sont simplement des avantages dont vous bénéficierez en soutenant le projet par un don!

THANKS FOR THE SUPPORT - MERCI POUR LE SOUTIEN - GRACIAS POR EL APOYO:

 

 

INTI ECO LODGE:

   

 

Hi I'm Anne, for those who do not know me yet, I launched this crazy project to build a sustainable eco-lodge in the middle of the Peruvian Amazon in November 2014.

Accompanied by friends, surrounding communities, and volunteers from all around the world, we have begun to transform an area that has suffered from illegal charcoal production into an authentic retreat, in perfect harmony with its environment.

We launched our first crowd funding campaign in April 2015, and collected $10,000 USD through generous donations!

 

SECTION 1: The Project:

What is a solidary eco lodge?

A 100% ecological experience that relies on the exchange between local populations.

 

Inti Eco Lodge will be an alternative to conventional tourism. We invite people to come and stay in a unique place in the heart of the Amazon jungle.

The goal is to create a wellness center based on self-sufficiency, where everyone can learn to live holistically and sustainably, relax, heal naturally, attend educational workshops and express creativity.

Inti Eco Lodge is the first lodge in the Amazon to use sustainable development concepts such as bio construction, rainwater harvesting, solar energy, permaculture, and the treatment and recycling of wastewater to avoid contamination.

 

The wood we use comes from trees of the surrounding area:

1 cut tree = 1 tree replaced / replanted

When replanting, we use endangered species and plants or trees with medicinal properties.In doing so we are creating areas of reforestation, conservation and education.

 

 

We are currently building a greenhouse with adobe bags, to grow organic fruits and vegetables. Additionally, we are digging out a natural pool of tropical aquatic plants, which will provide guests with an alternative swimming area to the river.

Located deep in the rainforest, we will provide jungle discovery walking and boat tours.

The lodge will offer various activities such as yoga, meditation, music, art, and wellness workshops, massages, kayak tours, stand up paddleboarding, archery, fishing, and cooking classes with our local organic products.  We will also offer care and treatment of traditional Amazonian plant medicines for those interested.

Inti Eco Lodge will be a place of solitude, where we will educate and raise awareness - with the collaboration of surrounding communities – on subjects such as sustainable development, alternative lifestyles, and the value of local organic products.

 

Accommodation:

Several lodging options will be available: a dormitory (with 24 beds), basic bungalows (without bathroom), superior bungalows (toilets and private bathroom) and luxurious cabanas tucked away in the trees.

I want to break the idea of “if it’s healthy or organic, it must be more expensive,” as I often hear in my feedback.

Rates of your stay will depend on accommodation, activities and budget to make the lodge affordable and enjoyable for everyone!

 

Proceeds:

A portion of the profits of our business will assist neighboring communities and their needs: we plan to build wells to access clean drinking water, dry toilets, or education centers, according to their needs.

  

Another part will be devoted to research and development of conservation/reforestation, education, and ecological projects, as well as wages for workers to ensure maintenance and proper functioning of the lodge.

 

Volunteering:

We are building the center with the help of volunteers from around the world. It's an amazing experience to bring together people of all ages, professions and backgrounds, while sharing the same core values ​​and commitment.

 

All volunteers simply want to learn and help; some have no construction experience, but simply the will to complement others with knowledge and skills in terms of construction, architecture, biotechnology or permaculture.

So why not you?

We want to think collectively and gather ideas to find the most appropriate and sustainable solutions to the various challenges of the project, and in total respect to the neighboring communities.

 

SECTION 2: What has been done since the 2015 campaign

We launched a campaign in April 2015 and through generous donations, we had the chance to make great strides forward in the project.

  • We were supplied with more tools and built a garage.
  • We constructed a 48-meter bridge to help reach another part of the land, when the river rises during rainy season.
  • We built a 24-bed dormitory for volunteers and future travelers.
  • We finished construction of the kitchen/restaurant, large dining room, and terrace.
  • We did half of the bio construction greenhouse. We are missing windows, doors, interior fittings and equipment for growing crops.
  • We made our first basic bungalow for 1 or 2 people in the middle of the jungle, below a small community of monkeys.
  • We set up different types of mounds outside for growing food, and gradually began harvesting some fruits and vegetables. We also started to make a botanical garden and a space for medicinal plants.
  • We dug out ¾ of the natural pool for aquatic plants and bought the large liner (geomembrane).

    

   

 

 

You trust us and so do they:

Since the Peruvian Ministry of Agriculture visited our project last summer, 100 hectares have been offered for reforestation of the Amazon.

Since the first campaign, a French production agency, Babel Press, has also been interested in the process of our project. A film crew immersed themselves in the jungle with us in September 2015, again in January 2016, and a last time in May 2016. Emotions and laughter guaranteed!

The documentary will be broadcast on the most famous channel in France "TF1" in the "Reportage" program on Sunday, February 26, 2017.

We are proud to have entered the Francophone travel guide le Petit Futé, to be considered a Climate Observer by France24, recognized as a solidary eco lodge by Mr Mondialisation, recommended by Earthship Biotecture and many other acknowledgments.

We thank them for their fantastic support, for their enthusiasm participates in the realization of this dream.

 

SECTION 3: What can be done with the money of this campaign:

We have set a goal of $10,000 to make the target reachable, but in reality we need more to complete the project as imagined.

Our primary objectives are to ensure the safety of people on site, to complete the various well-built structures and to furnish them, and start the reforestation project of 100 hectares given to us by the Ministry of Agriculture.

 

Specifically we would like:

  • To have a new boat because we can no longer provide transportation. We are 4 hours from the nearest hospital, but we can reduce this time, especially in the case of emergency, by also buying a good motor. ($5,000)
  • Install plumbing systems in the kitchen and restaurant ($2,000)
  • Purchase appliances for the kitchen, restaurant, and juice bar located on the terrace. ($3,000)
  • Furnish the dining room and terrace ($3,000)
  • Install plumbing systems and furnish the public bathroom of 6 showers, 4 sinks, and 4 dry toilets. ($4,000)
  • Furnish the dormitory with mattresses, sheets, mosquito nets, chests, and tables. ($5,000)
  • Build wooden bungalows with leaf roofs. ($2,500 / bungalow). We would like to build 8 to begin with.
  • Finish digging the natural pool and put in tropical aquatic plants, which will serve as filters in the first basin. We would also like to build a wooden boardwalk around the outside, and buy two solar pumps to circulate water in the second basin that will be used for swimming. ($3,000)
  • We would like to make more mounds outside for cultivating crops and obtain more germinated seeds/plants to put outside and in the greenhouse. ($1,000)
  • Buy solar panels, batteries, and converters to have electricity at the lodge. We indeed need energy for evening lights, kitchen appliances, water pumps, and recharging electronics like laptops, cameras, and tools. ($7,000)
  • Build the Maloca, a traditional large circular building, which will serve as a venue for various activities. ($12,000)
  • Build/purchase equipment for yoga, meditation, dance, and music classes ($5,000)
  • Buy equipment for kayaking, stand up paddleboarding, and archery ($3,000).
  • Construct a building for massages and buy the appropriate equipment. ($5,000).
  • Construct luxurious cabanas in the trees. ($5,000 to $10,000 per cabana).

 

The total amount necessary to complete the project is $80,000.

This is all possible with your support!

Here is how members of Inti Eco Lodge thank you:

The gifts below are NOT representative of the price of future stays at the lodge. They are simply “thank you” gifts you’ll receive by supporting the project with a donation!

 

Inti Eco Lodge website: http://intiecolodge.com/fr/accueil/

To See more picture on our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/intiecolodge/

Inti Eco Lodge Youtube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGwITUvi3nVVEgVmUNJvZjQ

Short film by Indio Martinez (July 2016): https://vimeo.com/205276765

 

 

 

........................................................................................................................................................

FRANCAIS:



INTI ECO LODGE:

   



Bonjour, je suis Anne, pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas encore, j´ai lancé ce projet fou de construire un lodge eco-solidaire, en plein milieu de l´Amazonie péruvienne, à côté d´Iquitos en novembre 2014.

 Accompagnée d´amis, des communautés environnantes, et de volontaires venant du monde entier, nous avons commencé à relever le défi de faire d´un terrain qui avait été victime de charbonnage sauvage, un lieu authentique,  insolite et en parfaite harmonie avec son environnement.

Nous avons lancé notre première campagne crowdfunding en Avril 2015 et nous avons récoltez grâce à vous et vos généreuses donations,  10 000 dollars!
 

SECTION 1: Le Projet.

Un lodge eco solidaire qu’est ce que c’est ? 

Une expérience 100% écologique qui s’appuie sur l’échange avec les populations locales.

 

Inti Eco Lodge sera une alternative au tourisme conventionnel, nous inviterons les personnes à venir séjourner dans un lieu authentique et insolite au cœur de la jungle amazonienne.

L´objectif est de créer un centre de bien-être basé sur l’autosuffisance, où chacun peut apprendre à vivre de façon saine et durable, se divertir, se détendre, se soigner naturellement, assister à des workshops et exprimer sa créativité.

Inti Eco Lodge sera le premier lodge en Amazonie à utiliser des concepts de développement durable tels que, la bio construction, la collecte et l'utilisation de l'eau de pluie, l´énergie solaire, l´incorporation de zones de production alimentaire à l´intérieur et à l´extérieur des habitations, et le traitement et la réutilisation des eaux usées pour éviter toute contamination.

 

Le bois que nous utilisons provient des arbres de la zone environnante, ainsi :

1 arbre coupé = 1 arbre remplacé/replanté

Lors de la replantation nous nous engageons à planter des espèces d´arbres en voie de disparition ou bien des arbres aux propriétés médicinales. Ainsi nous créons des espaces de reforestation, de conservation et d´éducation.

 



Nous construisons actuellement une serre avec des sacs d´adobe, pour les fruits et légumes bio. Nous creusons une piscine naturelle de plantes tropicales aquatiques qui permettra une zone de baignade alternative à la rivière.

 

Étant situés en pleine jungle, nous proposerons une expérience inoubliable d’immersion dans la faune et la flore amazonienne avec des randonnées découvertes à pied ou en bateau.

Le lodge offrira différentes activités telles que le yoga, la méditation, des workshops de musique, d´art et de bien-être, des massages, des tours en Kayak, du paddle board, du tir à l’arc, de la pêche et des cours de cuisine avec nos produits locaux.  Nous offrirons également la possibilité d’accéder à des soins et traitements de médecines traditionnelles locales.

Inti Eco Lodge sera un lodge Eco-Solidaire, où nous éduquerons et sensibiliserons - avec la collaboration des communautés - nos visiteurs, sur le développement durable, le mode de vie alternatif, et la valeur des produits sains et locaux.

 

Les hébergements :

Plusieurs options d’hébergement seront disponibles : un dortoir (avec 24 lits), des bungalows basiques (sans salle de bain), bungalows supérieurs (toilettes et salle de bain privée) et des cabanes, extra confortables, dans les arbres.

Je souhaite casser cette idée de : « si c’est sain ou si c’est Bio, c’est forcément plus cher », comme j’entends bien souvent lors de mes retours d’expériences.

Les tarifs de votre séjour dépendront de l’hébergement, des activités et du budget de chacun, afin de rendre le lodge accessible à tous!

 

Les bénéfices :

Les bénéfices de notre activité permettront d´aider les communautés voisines selon leurs besoins : nous projetons de leur construire des puits pour l´accès à l´eau potable, des toilettes sèches ou encore des centres d´éducation. 

  

Une autre partie sera destiné à la recherche et au développement de projets de conservation/reforestation, d’éducation, d´écologie, ainsi qu’à la rémunération des travailleurs, à l´entretien et au bon fonctionnement du lodge. 

 

Le Volontariat :

Nous construisons le centre avec l’aide de volontaires venant du monde entier. C’est une expérience exceptionnelle de rassembler des gens d’âges, de professions et d’horizons différents mais partageant tous les mêmes valeurs et le même engagement. 

 

Tous les bénévoles ont simplement la volonté d'apprendre et d’aider : certains n'ont aucune expérience en construction, mais une grande volonté qui se complémentarise avec d'autres qui ont les connaissances et compétences en terme de construction, d'architecture, biotecture ou permaculture.

Donc pourquoi pas vous ?

Nous voulons raisonner de manière collective et rassembler des idées afin de trouver les solutions les plus adaptées et durables aux différents challenges du projet et dans le respect le plus total des populations avoisinantes.

 

SECTION 2: Ce qu´on a fait depuis la campagne de 2015 

Nous avons lancé une campagne en avril 2015 et grâce à vous, à vos dons, nous avons eu la chance de pouvoir faire de grandes avancées dans le projet :

  • Nous avons commencé par acheter plus d´outils et nous avons construit un garage.
  • Nous avons fait un pont de 48m pour pouvoir atteindre facilement, quand la rivière monte pendant la saison des pluies, une autre partie du terrain.
  • Nous avons construit un grand dortoir pour les volontaires et futurs voyageurs.
  • Nous avons terminé les édifices de la cuisine/restaurant, salle à manger et la terrasse.
  • Nous avons terminé l’édifice de la salle de bain commune.
  • Nous avons fait la moitié de la bio construction. Il nous manque les vitres, les portes, l’aménagement de l’intérieur et le matériel pour la production alimentaire.
  • Nous avons fait notre premier bungalow basique pour 1 ou 2 personnes, au milieu de la jungle, en dessous d’une petite communauté de singes.
  • Nous avons mis en place différents types de buttes extérieures et nous commençons petit à petit à récolter certains fruits et légumes. Nous avons également commencé à faire un jardin botanique et un espace pour des plantes médicinales.
  • Nous avons creusé le ¾ de la piscine naturelle de plantes aquatiques et acheté un grand liner (géomembrane).

    

   

 

 

Vous nous faites confiance et eux aussi :

D’ailleurs depuis la visite du ministère de l'agriculture de notre projet l’été dernier, 100 hectares nous ont été offerts pour aider à la reforestation de l'Amazonie.

Depuis la première campagne, une agence de de production, l’agence Babel, s’est également intéressée à l´avancé de notre projet. Une équipe de tournage est venue en immersion totale, en septembre 2015, puis en janvier 2016 et une dernière fois en mai 2016. Emotions et fous rire garantis !Le documentaire sera diffusé sur TF1 dans l´émission “Reportage” le dimanche 26 février 2017 à 14h45.

Aussi, je dois dire que nous sommes fières d´être rentré dans le guide de voyage francophone le Petit Futé, avoir été considéré comme un observateur de climat par France24, nommé lodge eco solidaire par Mr Mondialisation, recommandé par Earthship Biotecture et bien d´autres articles…

Nous vous remercions pour votre fantastique soutien, pour l´engouement qu´attire ce projet et de participer à la réalisation de ce rêve !

 

SECTION 3: Ce qu´on pourra faire avec l´argent de cette campagne:

Nous avons mis un objectif à 10 000$ pour qu’il soit facile à atteindre mais en réalité nous avons besoin de bien plus afin de terminer le projet comme nous l’imaginons.

Nos objectifs premiers sont d´assurer la sécurité des personnes sur place, terminer les différentes constructions bien entamées puis les meubler et commencer le projet de reforestation des 100 hectares donné par le Ministère de l’Agriculture.

 

Concrètement nous aimerions :

  • Avoir un nouveau bateau car le notre ne peut malheureusement plus assurer les transports Nous sommes à 4h de l’hôpital le plus proche et nous pourrions réduire ce temps, surtout en cas d’urgence, en achetant également un bon moteur. (5000$)
  • Nous aimerions acheter le matériel nécessaire et des arbres pour la reforestation. (2000$)
  • Entreprendre la construction du système de tuyauterie de la cuisine, et du restaurant (2000$)
  • Acheter l’électroménager de la cuisine, du restaurant et du Juice Bar qui sera sur la terasse. (3000$)
  • Meubler la salle à manger et la terrasse. (3000$)
  • Meubler et entreprendre la construction du système de tuyauterie pour la grande salle de bain commune de 6 douches et 4 lavabos, 4 toilettes. (4000$)
  • Meubler le dortoir et acheter 24 matelas,  des draps et des moustiquaires. (5000$)
  • Construire des bungalows en bois avec toit en feuille. (2500$/ bungalow). Nous aimerions en construire 8 pour commencer.
  • Finir de creuser la piscine naturelle et y mettre des plantes tropicales aquatiques qui serviront de filtres dans un premier bassin. Nous aimerions également faire le contour en bois puis acheter deux pompes solaires pour la circulation de l´eau dans le bassin qui servira à la baignade. (3000$)
  • Nous aimerions faire plus de buttes/cultures, acheter plus de graines fertiles/arbres pour les cultures extérieures et la serre. (1000$)
  • Acheter des panneaux solaires, batteries, convertisseur pour avoir l´électricité dans le lodge. En effet nous avons besoin d’énergie pour des lumières le soir,  l’électroménager de la cuisine, les pompes pour les douches et enfin pour recharger des portables, des cameras et des outils. (7000$)
  • Construire la Maloca, un grand bâtiment circulaire qui servira de lieu pour les activités (12 000$)
  • Acheter le matériel pour le yoga, la méditation, la dance et les cours de musique. (5000$)
  • Acheter le matériel pour les activités de Kayak, paddle board et archerie. (3000$)
  • Faire un bâtiment pour les massages et acheter le matériel adéquat. (5000$).
  • Construire des cabanes insolites, extra confort dans les arbres. (5000 à 10 000$/ cabane).

Le montant total de nos besoin s’évalue à 80 000$ pour finaliser le projet.

Tout cela est possible grâce à votre soutien !


Voici comment l’ensemble des membres d’Inti Eco lodge vous remercie :

(Les cadeaux ci-dessous ne sont PAS représentatifs des coûts des futurs séjours au Lodge, ce sont simplement des avantages dont vous bénéficierez en soutenant le projet par un don !)

.......................................................................................................................................................................
ESPAÑOL

 

INTI ECO LODGE:


   

 

Hola, soy Ana para quienes no me conocen, en noviembre del 2014 puse en marcha este proyecto loco de construir un Eco-Lodge solidario en medio de la Amazonia peruana, junto a Iquitos.

Acompañada de amigos, las comunidades circundantes y voluntarios del mundo entero, comenzamos a afrontar el reto de hacer de un terreno que había sido víctima de la explotación salvaje de carbón, en un lugar auténtico, original y en perfecta armonía con su medio ambiente.

Lanzamos nuestra primera campaña de Crowdfunding en abril del 2015 y a través de ella hemos recolectado 10.000 dólares.


SECCIÓN 1: El proyecto:

Que es un lodge Eco-solidario?                   

un experiencia 100% ecológica que se basa en el intercambio con la población local.


 


Inti Eco Lodge será una alternativa al turismo convencional, invitaremos a la gente a venir a residir a un lugar único y auténtico en el corazón de la selva amazónica.

El objetivo es crear a una comunidad basada en el principio de autosuficiencia donde cada uno puede vivir de manera sana, aprender a vivir de manera duradera, divertirse, relajarse, sanarse naturalmente, desarrollar proyectos y expresar su creatividad.

Inti Eco Lodge será el primer Lodge en la Amazonía en utilizar los conceptos sustenibles tales como la bio-construcción, la recolección del agua y la utilización del agua de lluvia, la energía solar, la incorporación de zonas de producción de alimentos en el interior y el exterior de los edificios y el tratamiento y la reutilización de las aguas residuales para evitar toda contaminación.

 

La madera que utilizamos proviene de los árboles de los alrededores, así:

1 árbol cortado = 1 árbol reemplazado / replantado

Para la replantación estamos comprometidos con la plantación de árboles de especies en peligro de extinción o árboles con propiedades medicinales. Así creamos las áreas de reforestación, conservación y educación.

 
 

 

Estamos construyendo un invernadero con sacos de adobe para producir frutas y verduras orgánicas y una piscina natural de plantas acuáticas tropicales que permitirán una zona de baño alternativa al río.

 

 

 

Al estar situado en la selva, propondremos una experiencia inolvidable de inmersión en la fauna y la flora amazónica con excursiones a pie o en barco.

El Lodge ofrecerá diversas actividades como el yoga, la meditación, talleres de música, arte y bienestar, masajes, el tiro al arco, el paddle board, paseos en kayak, la pesca y clases de cocina con productos locales. También ofreceremos atención y tratamiento con plantas medicinales tradicionales locales para los interesados.

Inti Eco Lodge será un Lodge eco-solidario en donde educaremos y sensibilizaremos -con la colaboración de las comunidades- a nuestros visitantes sobre el desarrollo sostenible, el modo de vida alternativo y el valor de los productos sanos y locales.

 

Alojamiento:


Varias opciones de alojamiento estarán disponibles: habitaciones con 24 camas (y espacio para una hamaca), bungalós básicos (con una cama doble o dos camas individuales, aseo y un cuarto de baño público sin baños) o superior (inodoro y baño privado) y cabañas muy confortables en los árboles.

Quiero romper esta idea de "si está sano o si es orgánico es necesariamente más caro", como he oído muchas veces.

¡Las tarifas de su estancia dependerán del alojamiento, las actividades y el presupuesto de cada uno con el fin de hacer el Lodge accesible a todos!

 

Los Beneficios:

Los beneficios de nuestra actividad permitirán ayudar a las comunidades vecinas y, según sus necesidades, les construiremos pozos para el acceso al agua potable, baños secos o también centros de educación.


  
 

Otra parte irá hacia la investigación y el desarrollo de proyectos de conservación, educación, ecología, y a los salarios de los trabajadores, el mantenimiento y el buen funcionamiento del Lodge.

 

El Voluntariado:

Construimos el proyecto con la ayuda de voluntarios de todo el mundo. Es una experiencia increíble poder reunir a personas de diferentes edades, profesiones y orígenes pero todos compartiendo los mismos valores y el mismo compromiso.

 

Algunos voluntarios no tienen conocimiento en la construcción sino simplemente la voluntad deaprender y ayudar. Otros tienen experiencia y habilidades en construcción, arquitectura, construcción ecológica y permacultura.
 

Entonces ¿por qué no usted?

Queremos pensar colectivamente y reunir ideas para encontrar las soluciones más adecuadas y sostenibles para los distintos desafíos del proyecto y en total respeto de las comunidades vecinas.

 


SECCIÓN 2: ¡Lo que se hizo con el dinero de la campaña  2015!

Lanzamos una campaña en abril del 2015 y gracias a ustedes, a sus donaciones hemos tenido la oportunidad de hacer grandes avances en el proyecto:

 

  • Comenzamos por la compra de más herramientas y hemos construido un garaje.
  • Construimos un puente de 48 metros para poder llegar fácilmente al otro lado del terreno cuando el río sube su caudal durante la temporada de las lluvias.
  • Construimos un dormitorio para los voluntarios y futuros viajeros.
  • Hemos terminado los edificios de la cocina/restaurante, comedor y de la terraza.
  • Hemos terminado el edificio del baño público.
  • Hemos hecho la mitad de la bio-construcción (invernadero). Nos falta 
    las ventanas, las puertas, Acondicionamiento interior y el material para la producción alimentaria.
  • Hicimos un primer bungaló básico para 1 ó 2 personas en medio de la selva, por debajo de una pequeña comunidad de monos.
  • Establecimos diferentes modelos de cultivos exteriores y comenzamos poco a poco a cosechar algunas frutas y verduras. También comenzamos a hacer un pequeño jardín de plantas medicinales.
  • Hemos cavados los 3/4 de la piscina de plantas acuáticas, y hemos comprado un forro (geomembrana de pvc).

    

   

 

 

Ustedes confían en nosotros y ellos también:

El ministerio de la agricultura, después de haber visitado nuestro proyecto, decidió ofrecernos 100 hectáreas de terreno para ayudar a la reforestación de la Amazonia.

Desde el año pasado, tenemos la oportunidad de ser seguidos por un equipo de la agencia de producción Babel Press quienes han documentado el avance en nuestro proyecto. Llegaron por primera vez en septiembre del 2015, luego enero del 2016 y la última vez en mayo del 2016. El
documental será transmitido por TF1 el domingo 26 de febrero del 2017 a las 2:45 pm (hora francesa) en la emisión del programa "Reportage ". 

Estamos orgullosos de ser parte de la guía de viaje del guia francés “Petit Futé”, ser considerado como un observador climático por France24, nombrados “Eco Lodge Solidario” por Mr Mondialisation, recomendado por Earthship Biotecture y muchos otros artículos.

¡Les agradecemos para el fantástico apoyo que nos dan, el entusiasmo que genera este proyecto, y de participar en hacer nuestro sueño una realidad!


SECCIÓN 3: ¿Qué vamos a hacer con el dinero de esta campaña?:

Hemos puesto un objetivo de 10 000 dólares para que sea más fácil alcanzarlo, pero en realidad necesitamos mucho más para terminar el proyecto como lo imaginamos.

Nuestros objetivos principales son garantizar la seguridad de las personas en el terreno,
terminar las distintas construcciones ya empezadas así como amueblarlas, y empezar el proyecto de reforestación de los 100 hectáreas ofrecidos por el Ministerio de la Agricultura.


 

Concretamente nos gustaría:

  • Tener un barco nuevo, desgraciadamente el nuestro, ya no puede garantizar más los transporte. Estamos a 4 horas del hospital el más cercano y podríamos reducir ese tiempo, más que todo en caso de emergencia, con un buen motor. (5 000 dólares)
  • Comprar el material necesario y árboles para la reforestación. (2 000 dólares)
  • Empezar la construcción del sistema de tubería de la cocina y del restaurante. (2 000 dólares)
  • Comprar el equipo de la cocina, del restaurante y del Juice Bar de la terraza. (3 000 dólares)
  • Amueblar el comedor y la terraza. (3 000 dólares) 
  • Amueblar y empezar la construcción del sistema de tubería del baño público de 6 duchas 4 lavabos y 4 inodoros. (4 000 dólares)
  • Amueblar el dormitorio y comprar 24 colchones, sabanas y mosquiteros. (5 000 dólares)
  • Construir bungalós de madera con techo de hojas. (2 500 dólares/bungaló). Nos gustaría construir unos 8 para empezar.
  • Terminar de cavarla piscina natural y colocar las plantas tropicales que servirán de filtro en una primera pequeña piscina. Nos gustaría también hacer el contorno de madera y comprar dos bombas solares para la circulación del agua en la piscina que servirá para bañarse. (3 000 dólares)
  • Nos gustaría hacer mas huertos/cultivos, comprar más semillas fértiles/árboles para los cultivos exteriores y el invernadero. (1 000 dólares)
  • Comprar paneles solares, baterías, convertidores para tener electricidad en el lodge. Necesitamos energía para para las luces para la noche, el equipo de la cocina, las bombas para las duchas y para recargar celulares, cámaras, y las herramientas. (7 000 dólares)
  • Construir la maloca, un gran edificio circular que servirá como lugar para las actividades. (12 000 dólares)
  • Comprar el material para el yoga, la meditación, la danza, y los talleres de música. (5 000 dólares)
  • Comprar el material para las actividades de Kayak, paddle board y tiro al arco. (3 000 dólares)
  • Hacer un edificio para los masajes y comprar el material. (5 000 dólares)
  • Construir cabañas inusuales de gran comodidad en los árboles. (5 000 a 10 000 dólares)


Estimamos el monto total necesario a 80 000 dólares para completar el proyecto.

 

Todo esto es posible gracias a ustedes y sus donaciones que se recompensarán de distintas maneras como se muestra abajo. ¡Gracias!
