They are simply “thank you” gifts you’ll receive by supporting the project with a donation!Les cadeaux ne sont PAS représentatifs des coûts des futurs séjours au Lodge, ce sont simplement des avantages dont vous bénéficierez en soutenant le projet par un don!THANKS FOR THE SUPPORT - MERCI POUR LE SOUTIEN - GRACIAS POR EL APOYO:   INTI ECO LODGE:       Hi I'm Anne, for those who do not know me yet, I launched this crazy project to build a sustainable eco-lodge in the middle of the Peruvian Amazon in November 2014.Accompanied by friends, surrounding communities, and volunteers from all around the world, we have begun to transform an area that has suffered from illegal charcoal production into an authentic retreat, in perfect harmony with its environment.We launched our first crowd funding campaign in April 2015, and collected $10,000 USD through generous donations! SECTION 1: The Project:What is a solidary eco lodge?A 100% ecological experience that relies on the exchange between local populations.  Inti Eco Lodge will be an alternative to conventional tourism. We invite people to come and stay in a unique place in the heart of the Amazon jungle.The goal is to create a wellness center based on self-sufficiency, where everyone can learn to live holistically and sustainably, relax, heal naturally, attend educational workshops and express creativity.Inti Eco Lodge is the first lodge in the Amazon to use sustainable development concepts such as bio construction, rainwater harvesting, solar energy, permaculture, and the treatment and recycling of wastewater to avoid contamination. The wood we use comes from trees of the surrounding area: 1 cut tree = 1 tree replaced / replantedWhen replanting, we use endangered species and plants or trees with medicinal properties.In doing so we are creating areas of reforestation, conservation and education.   We are currently building a greenhouse with adobe bags, to grow organic fruits and vegetables. Additionally, we are digging out a natural pool of tropical aquatic plants, which will provide guests with an alternative swimming area to the river. Located deep in the rainforest, we will provide jungle discovery walking and boat tours.The lodge will offer various activities such as yoga, meditation, music, art, and wellness workshops, massages, kayak tours, stand up paddleboarding, archery, fishing, and cooking classes with our local organic products.  We will also offer care and treatment of traditional Amazonian plant medicines for those interested.Inti Eco Lodge will be a place of solitude, where we will educate and raise awareness - with the collaboration of surrounding communities – on subjects such as sustainable development, alternative lifestyles, and the value of local organic products. Accommodation:Several lodging options will be available: a dormitory (with 24 beds), basic bungalows (without bathroom), superior bungalows (toilets and private bathroom) and luxurious cabanas tucked away in the trees.I want to break the idea of “if it’s healthy or organic, it must be more expensive,” as I often hear in my feedback.Rates of your stay will depend on accommodation, activities and budget to make the lodge affordable and enjoyable for everyone! Proceeds:A portion of the profits of our business will assist neighboring communities and their needs: we plan to build wells to access clean drinking water, dry toilets, or education centers, according to their needs.   Another part will be devoted to research and development of conservation/reforestation, education, and ecological projects, as well as wages for workers to ensure maintenance and proper functioning of the lodge. Volunteering: We are building the center with the help of volunteers from around the world. It's an amazing experience to bring together people of all ages, professions and backgrounds, while sharing the same core values ​​and commitment.  All volunteers simply want to learn and help; some have no construction experience, but simply the will to complement others with knowledge and skills in terms of construction, architecture, biotechnology or permaculture.So why not you?We want to think collectively and gather ideas to find the most appropriate and sustainable solutions to the various challenges of the project, and in total respect to the neighboring communities. SECTION 2: What has been done since the 2015 campaignWe launched a campaign in April 2015 and through generous donations, we had the chance to make great strides forward in the project.
We were supplied with more tools and built a garage.
We constructed a 48-meter bridge to help reach another part of the land, when the river rises during rainy season.
We built a 24-bed dormitory for volunteers and future travelers.
We finished construction of the kitchen/restaurant, large dining room, and terrace.
We did half of the bio construction greenhouse. We are missing windows, doors, interior fittings and equipment for growing crops.
We made our first basic bungalow for 1 or 2 people in the middle of the jungle, below a small community of monkeys.
We set up different types of mounds outside for growing food, and gradually began harvesting some fruits and vegetables. We also started to make a botanical garden and a space for medicinal plants.
We dug out ¾ of the natural pool for aquatic plants and bought the large liner (geomembrane).
          You trust us and so do they:Since the Peruvian Ministry of Agriculture visited our project last summer, 100 hectares have been offered for reforestation of the Amazon.Since the first campaign, a French production agency, Babel Press, has also been interested in the process of our project. A film crew immersed themselves in the jungle with us in September 2015, again in January 2016, and a last time in May 2016. Emotions and laughter guaranteed!The documentary will be broadcast on the most famous channel in France "TF1" in the "Reportage" program on Sunday, February 26, 2017.We are proud to have entered the Francophone travel guide le Petit Futé, to be considered a Climate Observer by France24, recognized as a solidary eco lodge by Mr Mondialisation, recommended by Earthship Biotecture and many other acknowledgments.We thank them for their fantastic support, for their enthusiasm participates in the realization of this dream. SECTION 3: What can be done with the money of this campaign:We have set a goal of $10,000 to make the target reachable, but in reality we need more to complete the project as imagined.Our primary objectives are to ensure the safety of people on site, to complete the various well-built structures and to furnish them, and start the reforestation project of 100 hectares given to us by the Ministry of Agriculture. Specifically we would like:
To have a new boat because we can no longer provide transportation. We are 4 hours from the nearest hospital, but we can reduce this time, especially in the case of emergency, by also buying a good motor. ($5,000)
Install plumbing systems in the kitchen and restaurant ($2,000)
Purchase appliances for the kitchen, restaurant, and juice bar located on the terrace. ($3,000)
Furnish the dining room and terrace ($3,000)
Install plumbing systems and furnish the public bathroom of 6 showers, 4 sinks, and 4 dry toilets. ($4,000)
Furnish the dormitory with mattresses, sheets, mosquito nets, chests, and tables. ($5,000)
Build wooden bungalows with leaf roofs. ($2,500 / bungalow). We would like to build 8 to begin with.
Finish digging the natural pool and put in tropical aquatic plants, which will serve as filters in the first basin. We would also like to build a wooden boardwalk around the outside, and buy two solar pumps to circulate water in the second basin that will be used for swimming. ($3,000)
We would like to make more mounds outside for cultivating crops and obtain more germinated seeds/plants to put outside and in the greenhouse. ($1,000)
Buy solar panels, batteries, and converters to have electricity at the lodge. We indeed need energy for evening lights, kitchen appliances, water pumps, and recharging electronics like laptops, cameras, and tools. ($7,000)
Build the Maloca, a traditional large circular building, which will serve as a venue for various activities. ($12,000)
Build/purchase equipment for yoga, meditation, dance, and music classes ($5,000)
Buy equipment for kayaking, stand up paddleboarding, and archery ($3,000).
Construct a building for massages and buy the appropriate equipment. ($5,000).
Construct luxurious cabanas in the trees. ($5,000 to $10,000 per cabana).
 The total amount necessary to complete the project is $80,000.This is all possible with your support! Here is how members of Inti Eco Lodge thank you:The gifts below are NOT representative of the price of future stays at the lodge. They are simply “thank you” gifts you’ll receive by supporting the project with a donation! Inti Eco Lodge website: http://intiecolodge.com/fr/accueil/To See more picture on our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/intiecolodge/Inti Eco Lodge Youtube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGwITUvi3nVVEgVmUNJvZjQ Short film by Indio Martinez (July 2016): https://vimeo.com/205276765   ........................................................................................................................................................FRANCAIS: INTI ECO LODGE:      Bonjour, je suis Anne, pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas encore, j´ai lancé ce projet fou de construire un lodge eco-solidaire, en plein milieu de l´Amazonie péruvienne, à côté d´Iquitos en novembre 2014. Accompagnée d´amis, des communautés environnantes, et de volontaires venant du monde entier, nous avons commencé à relever le défi de faire d´un terrain qui avait été victime de charbonnage sauvage, un lieu authentique,  insolite et en parfaite harmonie avec son environnement.Nous avons lancé notre première campagne crowdfunding en Avril 2015 et nous avons récoltez grâce à vous et vos généreuses donations,  10 000 dollars! SECTION 1: Le Projet.Un lodge eco solidaire qu’est ce que c’est ?  Une expérience 100% écologique qui s’appuie sur l’échange avec les populations locales.  Inti Eco Lodge sera une alternative au tourisme conventionnel, nous inviterons les personnes à venir séjourner dans un lieu authentique et insolite au cœur de la jungle amazonienne.L´objectif est de créer un centre de bien-être basé sur l’autosuffisance, où chacun peut apprendre à vivre de façon saine et durable, se divertir, se détendre, se soigner naturellement, assister à des workshops et exprimer sa créativité.Inti Eco Lodge sera le premier lodge en Amazonie à utiliser des concepts de développement durable tels que, la bio construction, la collecte et l'utilisation de l'eau de pluie, l´énergie solaire, l´incorporation de zones de production alimentaire à l´intérieur et à l´extérieur des habitations, et le traitement et la réutilisation des eaux usées pour éviter toute contamination. Le bois que nous utilisons provient des arbres de la zone environnante, ainsi :1 arbre coupé = 1 arbre remplacé/replantéLors de la replantation nous nous engageons à planter des espèces d´arbres en voie de disparition ou bien des arbres aux propriétés médicinales. Ainsi nous créons des espaces de reforestation, de conservation et d´éducation.  Nous construisons actuellement une serre avec des sacs d´adobe, pour les fruits et légumes bio. Nous creusons une piscine naturelle de plantes tropicales aquatiques qui permettra une zone de baignade alternative à la rivière.  Étant situés en pleine jungle, nous proposerons une expérience inoubliable d’immersion dans la faune et la flore amazonienne avec des randonnées découvertes à pied ou en bateau.Le lodge offrira différentes activités telles que le yoga, la méditation, des workshops de musique, d´art et de bien-être, des massages, des tours en Kayak, du paddle board, du tir à l’arc, de la pêche et des cours de cuisine avec nos produits locaux.  Nous offrirons également la possibilité d’accéder à des soins et traitements de médecines traditionnelles locales.Inti Eco Lodge sera un lodge Eco-Solidaire, où nous éduquerons et sensibiliserons - avec la collaboration des communautés - nos visiteurs, sur le développement durable, le mode de vie alternatif, et la valeur des produits sains et locaux. Les hébergements : Plusieurs options d’hébergement seront disponibles : un dortoir (avec 24 lits), des bungalows basiques (sans salle de bain), bungalows supérieurs (toilettes et salle de bain privée) et des cabanes, extra confortables, dans les arbres.Je souhaite casser cette idée de : « si c’est sain ou si c’est Bio, c’est forcément plus cher », comme j’entends bien souvent lors de mes retours d’expériences.Les tarifs de votre séjour dépendront de l’hébergement, des activités et du budget de chacun, afin de rendre le lodge accessible à tous! Les bénéfices : Les bénéfices de notre activité permettront d´aider les communautés voisines selon leurs besoins : nous projetons de leur construire des puits pour l´accès à l´eau potable, des toilettes sèches ou encore des centres d´éducation.    Une autre partie sera destiné à la recherche et au développement de projets de conservation/reforestation, d’éducation, d´écologie, ainsi qu’à la rémunération des travailleurs, à l´entretien et au bon fonctionnement du lodge.  Le Volontariat :Nous construisons le centre avec l’aide de volontaires venant du monde entier. C’est une expérience exceptionnelle de rassembler des gens d’âges, de professions et d’horizons différents mais partageant tous les mêmes valeurs et le même engagement.   Tous les bénévoles ont simplement la volonté d'apprendre et d’aider : certains n'ont aucune expérience en construction, mais une grande volonté qui se complémentarise avec d'autres qui ont les connaissances et compétences en terme de construction, d'architecture, biotecture ou permaculture.Donc pourquoi pas vous ?Nous voulons raisonner de manière collective et rassembler des idées afin de trouver les solutions les plus adaptées et durables aux différents challenges du projet et dans le respect le plus total des populations avoisinantes. SECTION 2: Ce qu´on a fait depuis la campagne de 2015 Nous avons lancé une campagne en avril 2015 et grâce à vous, à vos dons, nous avons eu la chance de pouvoir faire de grandes avancées dans le projet :
Nous avons commencé par acheter plus d´outils et nous avons construit un garage.
Nous avons fait un pont de 48m pour pouvoir atteindre facilement, quand la rivière monte pendant la saison des pluies, une autre partie du terrain.
Nous avons construit un grand dortoir pour les volontaires et futurs voyageurs.
Nous avons terminé les édifices de la cuisine/restaurant, salle à manger et la terrasse.
Nous avons terminé l’édifice de la salle de bain commune.
Nous avons fait la moitié de la bio construction. Il nous manque les vitres, les portes, l’aménagement de l’intérieur et le matériel pour la production alimentaire.
Nous avons fait notre premier bungalow basique pour 1 ou 2 personnes, au milieu de la jungle, en dessous d’une petite communauté de singes.
Nous avons mis en place différents types de buttes extérieures et nous commençons petit à petit à récolter certains fruits et légumes. Nous avons également commencé à faire un jardin botanique et un espace pour des plantes médicinales.
Nous avons creusé le ¾ de la piscine naturelle de plantes aquatiques et acheté un grand liner (géomembrane).
          Vous nous faites confiance et eux aussi :D’ailleurs depuis la visite du ministère de l'agriculture de notre projet l’été dernier, 100 hectares nous ont été offerts pour aider à la reforestation de l'Amazonie.Depuis la première campagne, une agence de de production, l’agence Babel, s’est également intéressée à l´avancé de notre projet. Une équipe de tournage est venue en immersion totale, en septembre 2015, puis en janvier 2016 et une dernière fois en mai 2016. Emotions et fous rire garantis !Le documentaire sera diffusé sur TF1 dans l´émission “Reportage” le dimanche 26 février 2017 à 14h45.Aussi, je dois dire que nous sommes fières d´être rentré dans le guide de voyage francophone le Petit Futé, avoir été considéré comme un observateur de climat par France24, nommé lodge eco solidaire par Mr Mondialisation, recommandé par Earthship Biotecture et bien d´autres articles…Nous vous remercions pour votre fantastique soutien, pour l´engouement qu´attire ce projet et de participer à la réalisation de ce rêve ! SECTION 3: Ce qu´on pourra faire avec l´argent de cette campagne:Nous avons mis un objectif à 10 000$ pour qu’il soit facile à atteindre mais en réalité nous avons besoin de bien plus afin de terminer le projet comme nous l’imaginons.Nos objectifs premiers sont d´assurer la sécurité des personnes sur place, terminer les différentes constructions bien entamées puis les meubler et commencer le projet de reforestation des 100 hectares donné par le Ministère de l’Agriculture. Concrètement nous aimerions :
Avoir un nouveau bateau car le notre ne peut malheureusement plus assurer les transports Nous sommes à 4h de l’hôpital le plus proche et nous pourrions réduire ce temps, surtout en cas d’urgence, en achetant également un bon moteur. (5000$)
Nous aimerions acheter le matériel nécessaire et des arbres pour la reforestation. (2000$)
Entreprendre la construction du système de tuyauterie de la cuisine, et du restaurant (2000$)
Acheter l’électroménager de la cuisine, du restaurant et du Juice Bar qui sera sur la terasse. (3000$)
Meubler la salle à manger et la terrasse. (3000$)
Meubler et entreprendre la construction du système de tuyauterie pour la grande salle de bain commune de 6 douches et 4 lavabos, 4 toilettes. (4000$)
Meubler le dortoir et acheter 24 matelas,  des draps et des moustiquaires. (5000$)
Construire des bungalows en bois avec toit en feuille. (2500$/ bungalow). Nous aimerions en construire 8 pour commencer.
Finir de creuser la piscine naturelle et y mettre des plantes tropicales aquatiques qui serviront de filtres dans un premier bassin. Nous aimerions également faire le contour en bois puis acheter deux pompes solaires pour la circulation de l´eau dans le bassin qui servira à la baignade. (3000$)
Nous aimerions faire plus de buttes/cultures, acheter plus de graines fertiles/arbres pour les cultures extérieures et la serre. (1000$)
Acheter des panneaux solaires, batteries, convertisseur pour avoir l´électricité dans le lodge. En effet nous avons besoin d’énergie pour des lumières le soir,  l’électroménager de la cuisine, les pompes pour les douches et enfin pour recharger des portables, des cameras et des outils. (7000$)
Construire la Maloca, un grand bâtiment circulaire qui servira de lieu pour les activités (12 000$)
Acheter le matériel pour le yoga, la méditation, la dance et les cours de musique. (5000$)
Acheter le matériel pour les activités de Kayak, paddle board et archerie. (3000$)
Faire un bâtiment pour les massages et acheter le matériel adéquat. (5000$).
Construire des cabanes insolites, extra confort dans les arbres. (5000 à 10 000$/ cabane).
Le montant total de nos besoin s’évalue à 80 000$ pour finaliser le projet.Tout cela est possible grâce à votre soutien !Voici comment l’ensemble des membres d’Inti Eco lodge vous remercie :(Les cadeaux ci-dessous ne sont PAS représentatifs des coûts des futurs séjours au Lodge, ce sont simplement des avantages dont vous bénéficierez en soutenant le projet par un don !) Inti Eco Lodge site internet: http://intiecolodge.com/fr/accueil/Pour voir plus de photos sur notre page Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/intiecolodge/La chaine Youtube Inti Ecolodge: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGwITUvi3nVVEgVmUNJvZjQ Court métrage de Indio Martinez (Juillet 2016): https://vimeo.com/205270464 .......................................................................................................................................................................ESPAÑOL INTI ECO LODGE:       Hola, soy Ana para quienes no me conocen, en noviembre del 2014 puse en marcha este proyecto loco de construir un Eco-Lodge solidario en medio de la Amazonia peruana, junto a Iquitos.Acompañada de amigos, las comunidades circundantes y voluntarios del mundo entero, comenzamos a afrontar el reto de hacer de un terreno que había sido víctima de la explotación salvaje de carbón, en un lugar auténtico, original y en perfecta armonía con su medio ambiente.Lanzamos nuestra primera campaña de Crowdfunding en abril del 2015 y a través de ella hemos recolectado 10.000 dólares.SECCIÓN 1: El proyecto:Que es un lodge Eco-solidario?                    un experiencia 100% ecológica que se basa en el intercambio con la población local.  Inti Eco Lodge será una alternativa al turismo convencional, invitaremos a la gente a venir a residir a un lugar único y auténtico en el corazón de la selva amazónica.El objetivo es crear a una comunidad basada en el principio de autosuficiencia donde cada uno puede vivir de manera sana, aprender a vivir de manera duradera, divertirse, relajarse, sanarse naturalmente, desarrollar proyectos y expresar su creatividad.Inti Eco Lodge será el primer Lodge en la Amazonía en utilizar los conceptos sustenibles tales como la bio-construcción, la recolección del agua y la utilización del agua de lluvia, la energía solar, la incorporación de zonas de producción de alimentos en el interior y el exterior de los edificios y el tratamiento y la reutilización de las aguas residuales para evitar toda contaminación. La madera que utilizamos proviene de los árboles de los alrededores, así:1 árbol cortado = 1 árbol reemplazado / replantadoPara la replantación estamos comprometidos con la plantación de árboles de especies en peligro de extinción o árboles con propiedades medicinales. Así creamos las áreas de reforestación, conservación y educación.    Estamos construyendo un invernadero con sacos de adobe para producir frutas y verduras orgánicas y una piscina natural de plantas acuáticas tropicales que permitirán una zona de baño alternativa al río.    Al estar situado en la selva, propondremos una experiencia inolvidable de inmersión en la fauna y la flora amazónica con excursiones a pie o en barco.El Lodge ofrecerá diversas actividades como el yoga, la meditación, talleres de música, arte y bienestar, masajes, el tiro al arco, el paddle board, paseos en kayak, la pesca y clases de cocina con productos locales. También ofreceremos atención y tratamiento con plantas medicinales tradicionales locales para los interesados.Inti Eco Lodge será un Lodge eco-solidario en donde educaremos y sensibilizaremos -con la colaboración de las comunidades- a nuestros visitantes sobre el desarrollo sostenible, el modo de vida alternativo y el valor de los productos sanos y locales. Alojamiento: Varias opciones de alojamiento estarán disponibles: habitaciones con 24 camas (y espacio para una hamaca), bungalós básicos (con una cama doble o dos camas individuales, aseo y un cuarto de baño público sin baños) o superior (inodoro y baño privado) y cabañas muy confortables en los árboles.Quiero romper esta idea de "si está sano o si es orgánico es necesariamente más caro", como he oído muchas veces.¡Las tarifas de su estancia dependerán del alojamiento, las actividades y el presupuesto de cada uno con el fin de hacer el Lodge accesible a todos! Los Beneficios: Los beneficios de nuestra actividad permitirán ayudar a las comunidades vecinas y, según sus necesidades, les construiremos pozos para el acceso al agua potable, baños secos o también centros de educación.    Otra parte irá hacia la investigación y el desarrollo de proyectos de conservación, educación, ecología, y a los salarios de los trabajadores, el mantenimiento y el buen funcionamiento del Lodge. El Voluntariado: Construimos el proyecto con la ayuda de voluntarios de todo el mundo. Es una experiencia increíble poder reunir a personas de diferentes edades, profesiones y orígenes pero todos compartiendo los mismos valores y el mismo compromiso.  Algunos voluntarios no tienen conocimiento en la construcción sino simplemente la voluntad deaprender y ayudar. Otros tienen experiencia y habilidades en construcción, arquitectura, construcción ecológica y permacultura. Entonces ¿por qué no usted?Queremos pensar colectivamente y reunir ideas para encontrar las soluciones más adecuadas y sostenibles para los distintos desafíos del proyecto y en total respeto de las comunidades vecinas. SECCIÓN 2: ¡Lo que se hizo con el dinero de la campaña  2015! Lanzamos una campaña en abril del 2015 y gracias a ustedes, a sus donaciones hemos tenido la oportunidad de hacer grandes avances en el proyecto: 
Comenzamos por la compra de más herramientas y hemos construido un garaje.
Construimos un puente de 48 metros para poder llegar fácilmente al otro lado del terreno cuando el río sube su caudal durante la temporada de las lluvias.
Construimos un dormitorio para los voluntarios y futuros viajeros.
Hemos terminado los edificios de la cocina/restaurante, comedor y de la terraza.
Hemos terminado el edificio del baño público.
Hemos hecho la mitad de la bio-construcción (invernadero). Nos falta las ventanas, las puertas, Acondicionamiento interior y el material para la producción alimentaria.
Hicimos un primer bungaló básico para 1 ó 2 personas en medio de la selva, por debajo de una pequeña comunidad de monos.
Establecimos diferentes modelos de cultivos exteriores y comenzamos poco a poco a cosechar algunas frutas y verduras. También comenzamos a hacer un pequeño jardín de plantas medicinales.
Hemos cavados los 3/4 de la piscina de plantas acuáticas, y hemos comprado un forro (geomembrana de pvc).
          Ustedes confían en nosotros y ellos también:El ministerio de la agricultura, después de haber visitado nuestro proyecto, decidió ofrecernos 100 hectáreas de terreno para ayudar a la reforestación de la Amazonia.Desde el año pasado, tenemos la oportunidad de ser seguidos por un equipo de la agencia de producción Babel Press quienes han documentado el avance en nuestro proyecto. Llegaron por primera vez en septiembre del 2015, luego enero del 2016 y la última vez en mayo del 2016. Eldocumental será transmitido por TF1 el domingo 26 de febrero del 2017 a las 2:45 pm (hora francesa) en la emisión del programa "Reportage ". Estamos orgullosos de ser parte de la guía de viaje del guia francés “Petit Futé”, ser considerado como un observador climático por France24, nombrados “Eco Lodge Solidario” por Mr Mondialisation, recomendado por Earthship Biotecture y muchos otros artículos.¡Les agradecemos para el fantástico apoyo que nos dan, el entusiasmo que genera este proyecto, y de participar en hacer nuestro sueño una realidad!SECCIÓN 3: ¿Qué vamos a hacer con el dinero de esta campaña?:Hemos puesto un objetivo de 10 000 dólares para que sea más fácil alcanzarlo, pero en realidad necesitamos mucho más para terminar el proyecto como lo imaginamos.Nuestros objetivos principales son garantizar la seguridad de las personas en el terreno,terminar las distintas construcciones ya empezadas así como amueblarlas, y empezar el proyecto de reforestación de los 100 hectáreas ofrecidos por el Ministerio de la Agricultura. Concretamente nos gustaría: 
Tener un barco nuevo, desgraciadamente el nuestro, ya no puede garantizar más los transporte. Estamos a 4 horas del hospital el más cercano y podríamos reducir ese tiempo, más que todo en caso de emergencia, con un buen motor. (5 000 dólares)
Comprar el material necesario y árboles para la reforestación. (2 000 dólares)
Empezar la construcción del sistema de tubería de la cocina y del restaurante. (2 000 dólares)
Comprar el equipo de la cocina, del restaurante y del Juice Bar de la terraza. (3 000 dólares)
Amueblar el comedor y la terraza. (3 000 dólares) 
Amueblar y empezar la construcción del sistema de tubería del baño público de 6 duchas 4 lavabos y 4 inodoros. (4 000 dólares)
Amueblar el dormitorio y comprar 24 colchones, sabanas y mosquiteros. (5 000 dólares)
Construir bungalós de madera con techo de hojas. (2 500 dólares/bungaló). Nos gustaría construir unos 8 para empezar.
Terminar de cavarla piscina natural y colocar las plantas tropicales que servirán de filtro en una primera pequeña piscina. Nos gustaría también hacer el contorno de madera y comprar dos bombas solares para la circulación del agua en la piscina que servirá para bañarse. (3 000 dólares)
Nos gustaría hacer mas huertos/cultivos, comprar más semillas fértiles/árboles para los cultivos exteriores y el invernadero. (1 000 dólares)
Comprar paneles solares, baterías, convertidores para tener electricidad en el lodge. Necesitamos energía para para las luces para la noche, el equipo de la cocina, las bombas para las duchas y para recargar celulares, cámaras, y las herramientas. (7 000 dólares)
Construir la maloca, un gran edificio circular que servirá como lugar para las actividades. (12 000 dólares)
Comprar el material para el yoga, la meditación, la danza, y los talleres de música. (5 000 dólares)
Comprar el material para las actividades de Kayak, paddle board y tiro al arco. (3 000 dólares)
Hacer un edificio para los masajes y comprar el material. (5 000 dólares)
Construir cabañas inusuales de gran comodidad en los árboles. (5 000 a 10 000 dólares)
Estimamos el monto total necesario a 80 000 dólares para completar el proyecto. Todo esto es posible gracias a ustedes y sus donaciones que se recompensarán de distintas maneras como se muestra abajo. ¡Gracias!Los siguientes regalos NO son representativos de las tarifas de las futuras estancias en el Lodge, simplemente son ventajas de las que se beneficiará apoyando al proyecto con una donación! Inti Eco Lodge sitioweb: http://intiecolodge.com/fr/accueil/Para ver mas fotos sobre nuestra pagina Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/intiecolodge/El canal Youtube Inti Ecolodge: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGwITUvi3nVVEgVmUNJvZjQ Pequeña pelicula de Indio Martinez (Julio 2016): https://vimeo.com/205276765

story:
Welcome to our campaign!

 We are very happy you have decided to get to know more about our project!

We hope that after reading this page you will be as excited about our event as we are!

SHORT SUMMARY

Ambitious, motivated and creative Polish girls - vet students. United to take up a challenge - to organise the 67th IVSA Congress in Kraków.

  • 220 Delegates
  • 33 Countries
  • 4 Continents
  • 12 Days
  • 12 Committee Members
  • 1 Amazing Congress

 

The International Veterinary Students’ Association (IVSA) is a not-for-profit organization run by volunteer veterinary students.

The mission of IVSA is “To benefit the animals and people of the world by harnessing the potential and dedication of veterinary students to promote the international application of veterinary skills, education and knowledge.” IVSA unites over thirty thousand students, helping them to improve their skills as future veterinarians, gain experience and widen the knowledge about international methods and ways used in veterinary medicine, conservation of wild species and animal welfare. The way in which this is achieved is by arranging international Congresses, Symposia and Conferences, facilitating exchanges between our members and many projects and educational opportunities focusing on animal welfare, one health, education, soft skills and student wellness.

 

ABOUT THE CONGRESS

Due to the involvement of our chapter on the international level and our contribution to the development of the Association, IVSA Kraków has been honoured by being nominated and chosen for the host of the upcoming, 67th IVSA Congress.

IVSA Congress is the biggest and the most prestigious international event organised by and for veterinary students.

For the event we plan to accept 220 veterinary students representing over 30 countries. All eager to broaden their knowledge and gain practical experience in the veterinary field.

o When?

  • 16th-27th of July 2018

o Number of delegates

  • 220

o Main theme

  • Wellness of veterinary students and veterinarians

o Theme of the educational part

  • „Be a Supervet! – New approach to Veterinary Medicine”

 

We have planned for our delegates 12 days full of activities:

  • General Assemblies
  • Lectures and workshops
  • Development Fund Auctions
  • International Stands
  • Exchange Officers' meeting
  • Touristic attractions
  • Social events

There is no time to rest but a lot of time for self-development and wellness ;)

Preparing the event requires tremendous amount of time, effort and a big financial outlay.

 

EDUCATION

Educational part, which we are putting a lot of heart into. We are planning to organise general lectures addressed to all the delegates as well as lectures and workshops in six panels:

 

  • Companion animals
  • Bovine
  • Horses
  • Exotic animals
  • Swine
  • Bees

 

We have invited lecturers from UCVM JU-UA as well as speakers from outside of our University, also from abroad.

Delegates attending Congresses are motivated and search the possibilities of improving their qualifications in order to become successful veterinarians.

It is also one of the reasons for the theme of the educational part of the Congress, which focuses on innovation, research, new technologies and methods of treatment used in veterinary medicine.

WELLNESS

The main theme of the event is „Wellness”.

It is an extremely important, but most of the times neglected in the veterinary society issue, not only among veterinarians but also veterinary students, who struggle with many issues such as stress associated with work/studies.

We are planning lectures addressed to all the delegates, prepared by veterinarians in cooperation with psychologists as well as workshops with the psychology students’ group „Flow” and Wellness Committee of IVSA.

We would like to provide the delegates with the access to the gym/sports hall and organise events such as volleyball or soccer matches, kayaking, biking trips or a short dancing course. We want to make the students aware of how important physical activity is as well as having a hobby, which help to deal with the stress.

 

TURISTIC ATRACTIONS

During the Congress, Organising Committee strives to provide the delegates with the opportunity to learn about the history and culture of their own country. Due to the convenient location, we are able to offer trips to many facilities important both historically as well as culturally.

In the plan:

  • Kraków tour
  • Trip to the „Wieliczka” Salt Mine
  • Auschwitz – Birkenau Museum
  • Educational trip to the Tatra National Park

 

BUDGET

IVSA Congress is an event which requires many hours of preparations, many sacrifices as well as a huge financial outlay.

  • Fees from the delegates are covering 2/3 of the cost.
  • We have found companies willing to support us with the sponsorship as well.
  • But we are still looking for support, the campaign goal is 5000 $, nevertheless each contribution counts!

Therefore, we would like to ask you for the support of this amazing event, thus supporting young, ambitious students (soon to be veterinarians), whose the involvement of and the will to develop their knowledge and skills motivate them to participation in such events.

 

SUPPORT US

Take part in changing world of animals and people for better!

Support  development  of future veterinarians from all over the world!

It might be one of us who will treat your pet in the future!

 

  • We are very thankful to those supporting our project!
    Everyone donating money to our campaign will get a certificate and a personalized surprise from us - the delegates from all over the world!
  • If you would like to donate bigger amount of money and become our OFFICIAL SPONSOR, please contact us via our email: arsveterinaria.krakow@gmail.com. And we will provide you or your company with special personalized offer.  

 

MORE ABOUT US

If you got as excited about our project as we are and you would like to find more information about the Congress, Organizing Committee, our speakers, workshops, lectures, trips and our wonderful IVSA Family visit the following pages:

  • Official Congress facebook fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/67th-IVSA-Congress-in-...
  • Official Congress website: https://congress.arsveterinariakrakow.com/

Contact us:

  • email address: arsveterinaria.krakow@gmail.com
  • phone no.: +48 881 524 594

 

THANK YOU!
Vet students and animals from all over the world.
story_txt:
Welcome to our campaign!
 We are very happy you have decided to get to know more about our project!
We hope that after reading this page you will be as excited about our event as we are!

SHORT SUMMARY
Ambitious, motivated and creative Polish girls - vet students. United to take up a challenge - to organise the 67th IVSA Congress in Kraków.

220 Delegates
33 Countries
4 Continents
12 Days
12 Committee Members
1 Amazing Congress

 
The International Veterinary Students’ Association (IVSA) is a not-for-profit organization run by volunteer veterinary students.
The mission of IVSA is “To benefit the animals and people of the world by harnessing the potential and dedication of veterinary students to promote the international application of veterinary skills, education and knowledge.” IVSA unites over thirty thousand students, helping them to improve their skills as future veterinarians, gain experience and widen the knowledge about international methods and ways used in veterinary medicine, conservation of wild species and animal welfare. The way in which this is achieved is by arranging international Congresses, Symposia and Conferences, facilitating exchanges between our members and many projects and educational opportunities focusing on animal welfare, one health, education, soft skills and student wellness.

 
ABOUT THE CONGRESS
Due to the involvement of our chapter on the international level and our contribution to the development of the Association, IVSA Kraków has been honoured by being nominated and chosen for the host of the upcoming, 67th IVSA Congress.
IVSA Congress is the biggest and the most prestigious international event organised by and for veterinary students.
For the event we plan to accept 220 veterinary students representing over 30 countries. All eager to broaden their knowledge and gain practical experience in the veterinary field.
o When?
16th-27th of July 2018
o Number of delegates
220
o Main theme
Wellness of veterinary students and veterinarians
o Theme of the educational part
„Be a Supervet! – New approach to Veterinary Medicine”
 
We have planned for our delegates 12 days full of activities:

General Assemblies
Lectures and workshops
Development Fund Auctions
International Stands
Exchange Officers' meeting
Touristic attractions
Social events

There is no time to rest but a lot of time for self-development and wellness ;) 
Preparing the event requires tremendous amount of time, effort and a big financial outlay.
 
EDUCATION
Educational part, which we are putting a lot of heart into. We are planning to organise general lectures addressed to all the delegates as well as lectures and workshops in six panels:
 

Companion animals
Bovine
Horses
Exotic animals
Swine
Bees

 
We have invited lecturers from UCVM JU-UA as well as speakers from outside of our University, also from abroad.
Delegates attending Congresses are motivated and search the possibilities of improving their qualifications in order to become successful veterinarians.
It is also one of the reasons for the theme of the educational part of the Congress, which focuses on innovation, research, new technologies and methods of treatment used in veterinary medicine.

WELLNESS
The main theme of the event is „Wellness”.
It is an extremely important, but most of the times neglected in the veterinary society issue, not only among veterinarians but also veterinary students, who struggle with many issues such as stress associated with work/studies.
We are planning lectures addressed to all the delegates, prepared by veterinarians in cooperation with psychologists as well as workshops with the psychology students’ group „Flow” and Wellness Committee of IVSA.
We would like to provide the delegates with the access to the gym/sports hall and organise events such as volleyball or soccer matches, kayaking, biking trips or a short dancing course. We want to make the students aware of how important physical activity is as well as having a hobby, which help to deal with the stress.
 
TURISTIC ATRACTIONS
During the Congress, Organising Committee strives to provide the delegates with the opportunity to learn about the history and culture of their own country. Due to the convenient location, we are able to offer trips to many facilities important both historically as well as culturally.
In the plan:

Kraków tour
Trip to the „Wieliczka” Salt Mine
Auschwitz – Birkenau Museum
Educational trip to the Tatra National Park

 
BUDGET
IVSA Congress is an event which requires many hours of preparations, many sacrifices as well as a huge financial outlay.

Fees from the delegates are covering 2/3 of the cost.
We have found companies willing to support us with the sponsorship as well.
But we are still looking for support, the campaign goal is 5000 $, nevertheless each contribution counts!

Therefore, we would like to ask you for the support of this amazing event, thus supporting young, ambitious students (soon to be veterinarians), whose the involvement of and the will to develop their knowledge and skills motivate them to participation in such events.
 
SUPPORT US
Take part in changing world of animals and people for better! 
Support  development  of future veterinarians from all over the world!
It might be one of us who will treat your pet in the future!
 

We are very thankful to those supporting our project!Everyone donating money to our campaign will get a certificate and a personalized surprise from us - the delegates from all over the world!
If you would like to donate bigger amount of money and become our OFFICIAL SPONSOR, please contact us via our email: arsveterinaria.krakow@gmail.com. And we will provide you or your company with special personalized offer.  
 
MORE ABOUT US
If you got as excited about our project as we are and you would like to find more information about the Congress, Organizing Committee, our speakers, workshops, lectures, trips and our wonderful IVSA Family visit the following pages:
Official Congress facebook fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/67th-IVSA-Congress-in-...

Official Congress website: https://congress.arsveterinariakrakow.com/


Contact us:

email address: arsveterinaria.krakow@gmail.com

phone no.: +48 881 524 594

story:
Be a part of something big: 

Join Postpartum Support International (PSI) and 2020 Mom in funding two projects which will launch with your support in 2018.

The PSI perinatal mental health certification program:  This program will both test for proficiency in understanding core competencies and provide a clinical credential to perinatal mental health specialists making it easier for providers to promote their expertise and for patients in need to find them.

2020 Mom Maternal Mental Health State Advocacy Support: Funding will support 2020 Mom in bringing together advocates and legislators in states working on maternal mental health legislation. We will share historical legislation, lessons learned (like the published research on the NJ law) and create a circle of support for this important work.

What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is $3000.  Your contribution will help us get there.  

Get your choice of perks, including perks like: 

Autographed copy of The Art of Holding, by best selling author, Karen Kleiman, LCSW

Coaching session with PSI Executive Director Wendy Davis, PhD

Essential Oil Kit and Consult on using oils to treat depression and anxiety with Christine Hibbert, PhD

Dinner with 2020 Mom forum speakers and sponsors, including Katherine Wisner, MD and Roseanne Clark, PhD in L.A. Feb 8, 2018.

Spread the Word!  We need your help getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks a Million,

Joy Burkhard, MBA and Wendy Davis, PhD

Joy@2020Mom.org, Wdavis@postpartum.net

story:
Welcome to Tribal Village !

Para espanol, click here.

En Français, cliquer ici.

Tribal Village is a conscious Ecovillage and Retreat Center in Guatemala, Lake Atitlan. We invite you to co-create with us a place of spiritual evolution.

Tribal Village was created so that a global family of visionaries, healers and lightworkers would have a physical home in an inspiring and supportive environment.

We believe that a better, more connected world is possible. Tribal Village is a place where we are building this world. And we want you to be part of it.  

The Tribal Village family has been growing rapidly. Since its opening, one and half year ago, we are welcoming hundreds of volunteers, cocreators and guests in a space of love, sharing and learning. Tribal Village is the home to a variety of retreats, workshops, ceremonies and Full Moon celebrations.

Why do we need support ?

We acquired a new land next to the houses we rent, and we want to transform it in a Glamping Tepees area, with 5 traditional tepees, dry toilet, shower and a terrace for Morning Yoga practice.

We as well need to upgrade our community kitchen, as we are offering this year packages with food (breakfast and lunch) included.

Until now, we could welcome 25 people between our tents, the dormitory, and the few rooms we have. With 5 tepees more, we can receive 10 people more, so 35, in an organic comfortable space, connected with Nature.

So we need at least 5000 USD to buy :

  • 5 tepees of 3.5 meters diameter (as the tepees are made in Mexico, we need to ship them with Private courier, so the total cost of one tepee is 700 USD)
  • 5 mattresses double size (each costs 80 USD) and bed-sheets, mosquito net.
  • 5 wooden trunks with locks for people to secure their belongings (each trunk is big enough for a backpack and costs 80 USD)
  • A new gas stove with 6 outlets ; 200 USD
  • 3 Tables for the kitchen : 240 USD
  • Shelves and cupboard for the community food : 400 USD
  • Dry toilet next to the tepees : 1000 USD
  • Showers next to the tepees : 1000 USD with hot water
  • TOTAL EXPENSES : 7140 USD

You see that the total cost is more than 5000 USD, so if we get more, you know what we will do with it !

What will you get by supporting us ?

Support us and receive different Perks ! The best for us is that you come visit and stay with us, that you can experience truly what is going on here ! So you are welcome to join us !

5 USD : THANK YOU !!! Get your name on our Board of Gratitude!

10 USD : Tribal Village cotton bag with our logo in black & white

25 USD : Fermentation workshop (3 hours) and delicious vegan lunch in Tribal Village

25 USD : Delicious Vegan Lunch in Tribal Village and 1h30 workshop in the afternoon

30 USD : 1 Full Moon Celebration ticket 

55 USD : 2 Full Moon Celebration tickets 

100 USD : 3 nights in a Glamping tepee, with Reconnection to Self retreat package.

200 USD : 7 nights in a Glamping tepee with Reconnection to Self retreat package.

400 USD : 15 nights in a Glamping  tepee with Reconnection to Self retreat package.

400 USD : 30 nights in your own tent with Reconnection to Self retreat package.

 

The Impact

Our community space is unique because here, everyone is empowered to share their Light, talents and skills in service to each other and to the environment.

Right on the shore of the lake, in a quiet and pristine natural surrounding, we have manifested this Oasis of Wellness for peaceful and spiritual warriors.

We offer retreat packages where everyone can come to morning practice (yoga, Qi gong, meditation) and to an afternoon session (healing, lectures, ceremony, drumming, music, dancing, women circles...). Breakfast and Lunch are included 5 days a week, and a community kitchen is available for dinners and weekends.

Our center provides an incredible space to reconnect with yourself, to go deep into your healing journey, to meet beautiful people from all over the world and to celebrate life !

As we enter the new paradigm, we invite everyone who shares our vision to cocreate consciously with us!

By helping us, you become part of a project that supports personal and collective growth, the environment, and the local community.

Tribal Village is connected to an expanding network of conscious individuals, projects and  communities, all around the world, and specially here, around the Lake Atitlan.

Risks & Challenges

To hold space for a Retreat Center in Guatemala can be challenging. The materials are quite expensive, and there are no second hand or recycled stuff to collect like in Europe.

The manpower needs to be trained to match the eco friendly and organic standards we want.

We try to do many things by ourselves, but it is as well important to support the local community and to give them jobs,as many villages around the lake are struggling with poverty.

We really want to include the villagers and local workers in our project, to provide them education and give them new ideas to expand their life in a  sustainable way.

 

Our Motivated Team

Memé Gorchs, 37 years old, born in Argentina- South America, has a degree in MBA at Faculty of Economics at Buenos Aires University (UBA). She went travelling then for 10 years, studying Healing, Yoga, massage and ancient shamanic practices.

Memé has very good skills at organizing, dealing with logistics, negotiation, legal matters and managing human resources. Her mother tongue is Spanish language. She also speaks English, German and Portuguese. This allows her to bridge the international community of the project and the local people in Guatemala. She has a good ability to understand and to listen to people to bring harmony in communities and groups.

Demian Haye holds a Ph.D. in Cultural Management (event artistic management) but currently is more focused on healing arts and a teacher in holistic healing and alchemic arts. Born in France, 42 years ago, Demian Haye spent the last 16 years in India, and currently resides in San Marcos, Atitlan, Guatemala. He still travels a lot all around the world to gather ancient knowledge to bring it to the world. He studied Ayurveda and herbalism with the  European Institute of Vedic Studies of Atreya.

With his school, Magic Vibrations Healing, he has been teaching since 2005 many different workshops. He also developed his own brand of alchemy preparations.

He built his own understanding of how all these aspects interact in a higher holistic perspective. This is what he likes to share in workshops and retreats, in Tribal Village Retreat Center.

Anna Mironova is originally from Russia, where she studied Commercial Law at the Governmental Saint Petersburg University with focus on Copyrights and Internet. At the same time Anna studied Taijiquan Chen and different styles of Tao Qigong for more that 7 years at Traditional Family School of Wushu and Qigong with a chinese Master and Doctor of acupuncture. Anna is champion of Russia of Taijiquan 2001, Reiki master and a Certified guide in the wild nature.

She offers classes, workshops, courses, retreats and thematic travels all around the world since 2001. Also Anna participated in various popular courses from the impact and eco-living sphere including massages, chiropractic, traditional ceremonies, natural healing, offering sacred crafts workshops, experienced in cooking for thousands of people and sacred song singing among others.  For the Tribal Village, Anna hold daily classes for the residents, courses, retreats of Qigong and Taijiquan, she is focalizing our Calendar, designs and digital presence and supports the organization of the retreats.

Shantaram is an altruist humanist that has a passion for self transformation and for helping others to expand towards a global wellbeing. Social Educator since a young age, he developed many skills of communication and organization, relating to teenagers, mentally and physically challenged people, elders and children. As the initiator of many socio cultural projects in North West Africa, he got rewarded few times by French Institutions.

Yogi and musician, he cultivates the qualities of sharing and peace. After many experiences of communities, collective projects and travels, he acquired many skills to manage efficiently and wisely the Tribal Village Project, that he initiated 3 years ago.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support us with money, please consider to share this campaign with your family, your friends, on social medias and around you !

We are so many on Earth doing our best to provide some oasis of Wellness to expand our consciousness and meet like minded people ! Let's support each other in one way or another !

Remember you can use the Indiegogo Sharing Tools !

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, and to watch our video.

We love you, we honor you and we are grateful to you !

story:
“It only takes a spark to get a fire going, and soon all those around can warm up to its glowing. That’s how it is with God love once you’ve experience it, you want to sing, it’s fresh like spring, you want to pass it on!” 

In Danny's Honor...

We met our friend Dan Miltner at Lutheran Lakeside Camp in the early 1980’s as camp staff or even first as campers. During those pilgrimages to Lakeside every summer, we grew up with Danny.  All of us have stories about how he touched our lives in a very special way. 

Those days of summertime happiness have turned into lifelong friendships for all of us, and Danny was that common connecter through the years who befriended all of us. Even now, more than 30 years later, all of us share a mutual awe of Danny. He was dedicated to helping others. He possessed an amazing ability to get people to smile—and even to belly laugh. He was the consummate teacher, a selfless leader; a champion of what is good in this world, and a fantastic son, brother, husband, father, and friend.

On March 31, 2014, we attended his funeral. Losing Danny has reminded us how deep the relationships that began at Lutheran Lakeside Camp run.  As we grieve with Kerri, the kids, Roy, Freda, Steve, the extended family, and ourselves, we feel compelled to do “something.”

Our initial thought was to create a memorial at Lakeside for Danny. But we believe Danny would be too humble for such a tribute. He would, however, welcome appreciation for the entire Miltner family for the impact they have all had and continue to have on each of us. Now that would be something Danny would like!

The Miltner Era at LLC

The “Miltner” era at LLC was wonderful and memorable. Pastor Roy served as Director of LLC from 1976-1988 with wife, Freda, by his side. Roy and Freda had a hand in bringing us to LLC, staffers and campers alike. They shared their family with all of us through their dedication to the camp. Their legacy continues to make a difference in the lives of countless numbers of families, campers, and staffers alike. Danny and Kerri’s relationship grew as they worked together at Lakeside, and soon many of our lives were further enriched with their marriage and family.

The Miltner Retreat Center

To honor Danny, and in recognition of the impact the entire Miltner family has had on Lutheran Lakeside, we encourage you to join us in making a gift in Danny’s memory and in tribute to the entire Miltner family to the LLC “All Are Welcome” campaign.  Working with the camp leadership, we have decided to focus these gifts to create the “Miltner Retreat Center”. 

This project will renovate the Camp House formerly the Property Managers residence near the main entrance to the camp. The lower level will include a great room, kitchenette and two bunk style rooms, private restrooms and showers. The main level will also include a great room, open kitchen and five bedrooms with private restrooms and showers. Both levels will create a place for classes, workshops, conversation and study. The house has heating and air conditioning. 

The cost of the total renovation is $150,000.  (You can learn more about the specifics of the campaign by going to: www.Lutheranlakesidecamp.com.) If you have already given to the campaign, you can simply indicate to the camp that you want your gift designated toward the Miltner Retreat Center.  

In addition, funds exceeding the amount needed for the building will be applied to endow annual camperships called the Danny “Fun Check” Miltner campership to allow additional campers to experience LLC.

Thank you for your consideration of helping with this effort!

Eric and Beth Carlson  

Mark and Debra Hansen

Dan and Joan Kahl

Todd and Angela Linden

“A faithful friend is a sturdy shelter; he who finds one finds a treasure.” –Sirach 6:14

first as campers. During those pilgrimages to Lakeside every summer, we grew up
with Danny.  All of us have stories about
how he touched our lives in a very special way. 

Those days of summertime
happiness have turned into lifelong friendships for all of us, and Danny was
that common connecter through the years who befriended all of us. Even now,
more than 30 years later, all of us share a mutual awe of Danny. He was
dedicated to helping others. He possessed an amazing ability to get people to
smile—and even to belly laugh. He was the consummate teacher, a selfless
leader; a champion of what is good in this world, and a fantastic son, brother,
husband, father, and friend.
On March 31, 2014, we attended
his funeral. Losing Danny has reminded us how deep the relationships that began
at Lutheran Lakeside Camp run.  As we
grieve with Kerri, the kids, Roy, Freda, Steve, the extended family, and ourselves,
we feel compelled to do “something.” 
Our initial thought was to
create a memorial at Lakeside for Danny. But we believe Danny would be too
humble for such a tribute. He would, however, welcome appreciation for the
entire Miltner family for the impact they have all had and continue to have on
each of us. Now that would be something Danny would like!
The Miltner Era at LLCThe “Miltner” era at LLC
was wonderful and memorable. Pastor Roy served as Director of LLC from 1976-1988 with wife, Freda, by his side. Roy and Freda had a hand in bringing us to LLC, staffers and campers alike. They shared their family with all of us through their dedication to the
camp. Their legacy continues to make a difference in the lives of countless
numbers of families, campers, and staffers alike. Danny and Kerri’s
relationship grew as they worked together at Lakeside, and soon many of our
lives were further enriched with their marriage and family.The Miltner Retreat Center
To honor Danny, and in recognition of the impact the entire Miltner family has
had on Lutheran Lakeside, we encourage you to join us in making a gift in
Danny’s memory and in tribute to the entire Miltner family to the LLC “All Are
Welcome” campaign.  Working with the camp
leadership, we have decided to focus these gifts to create the “Miltner Retreat
Center”. This project will renovate the Camp House formerly the Property
Managers residence near the main entrance to the camp. The lower level will
include a great room, kitchenette and two bunk style rooms, private restrooms
and showers. The main level will also include a great room, open kitchen and
five bedrooms with private restrooms and showers. Both levels will create a place
for classes, workshops, conversation and study. The house has heating and air
conditioning. The cost of the total renovation is $150,000.  (You can learn more about the specifics of
the campaign by going to: www.Lutheranlakesidecamp.com.) If you have already given
to the campaign, you can simply indicate to the camp that you want your gift
designated toward the Miltner Retreat Center.  In addition, funds exceeding the amount needed for the building will be
applied to endow annual camperships called the Danny “Fun Check” Miltner
campership to allow additional campers to experience LLC.Thank you for your
consideration of helping with this effort!Eric and Beth Carlson  Mark and Debra HansenDan and Joan KahlTodd and Angela Linden


“A faithful
friend is a sturdy shelter; he who finds one finds a treasure.” –Sirach
6:14

story:
Who we are

WomELLE is a community for the support and advancement of women. We offer free mentoring program to women, WomELLE truly believe in mentoring and how it can help change women life. This program is our core program and will positively inspire women to fulfill their potential. WomELLE is opening a thrift store, on the web and app to fund the mentoring program. We need your help! 

Link to News:  https://tinyurl.com/jyd8hch

WomELLE is already helping thousands of women across America and now we are helping shoppers just like you to make a difference when you shop. We are proud to bring WomELLE Second Hand Store to you but we need your help!  Donate now to back us and claim a great reward. For more info, scroll through our story!

We need your help to raise the $15,000 we need to open the store so we can continue our mentoring program - donate now and let’s make a difference in women's' lives together! With your help and support we can open a store, finish developing website  and app that’s convenient for you wherever you are.  Come in and browse in person or shop from your computer, smartphone or tablet. 

Please contribute so you can create a better World every time you shop, and empower millions more women around the World to do the same! Each Perk come with a lifetime membership which gives you the opportunity to put items on hold for 12 hours,  5% OFF on all items, and 10% off on your birthday. 

Read our story to find out who we are.

Our Team 

OUR VALUES

We undertake to be open, honest and accountable in our relationships with everyone we work with, and with each other.

STANDING ON WHAT WE BELIEVE TO BE TRUE IS WHAT WE ASK FROM OUR LEADERSHIP AND OUR BOARD.

We will listen and respect each other's views.

Be accountable

Empower and Excite

Practice open communication and trust.

SEE WHAT WE SEE WITHIN OURSELVES AND OUR ORGANIZATION

Transparency

Accountability

Integrity

Courage

Solidarity 

Let's bring WomELLE Second Hand Store to life 

We want to bring the WomELLE Second Hand Store to everyone so millions of people get the chance to make a difference every time they shop.  10% from each item sold  goes toward supporting women.

$15,000 will fund the work needed to open the store, finish the online store and app by May 2017.  This amount will cover the local store and final development of the website and app. All donations are Tax Deductible. 

This amount will cover: 

1- Finish developing website for store 

2- Develop the app (IOS & Android) 

And keep our mentoring program free to women. 

What are the risks?

They're pretty low. WomELLE already exists. It's popular and helps thousands of women in United States.  We're raising the money we need to pay our developer to finish  the website and app to suit our online store but mostly we're raising money so we can create a more efficient and affordable way to find and purchase pre-loved items.

We need your help to bring the WomELLE Second Hand Store to life. Choose one of our rewards to back the campaign!

Back the Campaign Now to Score These Great Perks

Help Spread the Word

We want to see a World where women can help themselves and support their family. A World where people can shop and help at the same time. Where it’s easy for you and everyone else, to shop for second hand products AND support their deeply held values.

Together we can make a huge difference to women who need our support to help themselves, to care for our children facing poverty and needless suffering.

Can you help get the word out?

We'd love it if you could contribute to the campaign but if that's not possible - or you already have - here are some more ways to help:

1. Sign up to be notified when the store is launched in May 2017

2. Share the campaign on on Facebook, Instagram or any other social media - use hashtag  #WomELLEsecondhandstore

3. Tell you friends about the WomELLE Second Hand Store campaign, in the real world or by email

4. Check out the WomELLE website,  and join WomELLE Community.

5. Support the brands and organizations that are supporting us

6. Or get in touch for more ideas about how you can get involved

story:
Short Summary

 

1 Canadian in 5 will personally experience a mental illness in their lifetime. Five out of the 10 leading causes of disability worldwide are mental disorders. About 4,000 Canadians commit suicide each year and It represents 24% of all deaths among 15-24 year olds. Once depression is recognized, help can make a difference for 80% of people who are affected, allowing them to get back to their regular activities.

 

As our world has gotten busier and more technologically connected than ever before, the realm of counselling has advanced right alongside. At Ignited Minds, we are keen to do our best to meet client needs through video calls, while also ensuring we adhere to our professional and ethical obligation as we make all reasonable efforts to safeguard client confidentiality at every turn. Our practice consists of students who are actively studying to obtain their Masters degree and pursue counselling as a career. 

 

The title “counsellor,” is unregulated in the province of British Columbia. With that being said, anyone can throw a sign on their door and call themselves a counsellor. However, at Ignited Minds, we support the growth of Undergraduate students who are looking to gain experience in the industry;  Having the option to work as a freelance counsellor is a great opportunity for those looking to gain counselling experience, earn income part time, and work flexible hours while still accommodating one’s school schedule.

I came up with this idea and business structure because I understand the struggle of being a full time student, looking for part time work that could coexist with my school schedule while doing everything I possibly can to pay bills, and make ends meet in our costly city- while also maintaining a healthy work/life balance. 

 

I took what I knew was a struggle for many millennials like myself, and created a solution. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to raise $5000 for marketing purposes. We're in the process of collaborating with both Narcity Vancouver and Daily Hive Vancouver- we want to be prepared for any costs that come with these deals.

I'd like to to create brand awareness and build client acquisition. 

The Impact

My vision revolves around helping people transform their personal challenges into life-enhancing opportunities; and to support undergraduates in an atmosphere that promotes self exploration and growth.

Students shouldn't have to feel limited to part time retail or office jobs. It's hard to find a job that accommodates ones school schedule; maintaining a work-life balance is about separating your personal and professional lives without allowing one to encroach upon the other. Both are important, neither should be neglected- but it's even harder to maintain this balance once you've secured a job, especially for college and university students.

This project can be seen as valuable to many because we all know what it's like having to struggle to make ends meet in what is tough day and age to be a millennial in Vancouver.

Counselling sessions at Ignited Minds are only $35 for a 1 hour virtual session. 70% of the earnings go directly into the pocket of the student counsellor- That's $24.50 worth of earnings!

Help us support students, low income individuals, those on dreadful wait lists, and everyone else in their moment of need.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Lets get the word out there and make some noise with this campaign! 

Please use the Indiegogo share tool and share this on your social media page to help us out!

Simply sharing this link helps us make an impact.

story:
Help me get this out of the way.

I hate running!

I hate how I breathe like a pig. How my limbs fumble like noodles. How my hair splits down the middle without mistake every single time. And most important of all, I hate how hard it is!

Yet, here I am. 1 month away from the NYC Marathon, asking for your support so I can enter.

 

Why am I doing this to myself?

Because I’m not running alone. 

10 months ago, out of curiosity, I joined Back on my Feet (BoMF), a non-profit that helps homeless people restore confidence and strength through running. Members, who maintain 90% attendance of the running program, will receive access to employment and housing resources.

I started running with the team at 5:30AM a few mornings of the week. Together, we ran through the snowstorms of NYC, the melting heat of the West Side Highway, and over countless miles, bridges and boroughs. The best part is that I was always cheered on by one of the guys at Samaritan Daytop Village -- a recovery program and shelter for homeless veterans.

 

        

They are among the most caring, affectionate, positive people that I have ever met. Every morning, they shower me with hugs and encouragement. Their confidence planted an idea that maybe (just maybe) I could run this marathon. I've slowly started to believe it. And now, I'm going to do it!

 

Why fund-racing?

I'm not officially qualified for the marathon. The only way I can gain entry is by fundraising for an NYRR charity partner.

I've chosen to raise $3,000 for Back on my Feet (BoMF) and have chipped in $300 of my personal savings because I strongly believe in their mission. I believe that the discipline in running can be transferred to all areas of our lives and that a supportive community can get you anywhere.

Please support me as a backer of this beautiful mission. Thank you!

story:
Hi guys!

At the end of each day, I'm in awe at how much I'm blessed with whether it be the comfort of a home, the luxury of an education, or the beauty of loved ones. It's overwhelming and I just want to give a little back to who are less fortunate. Even if my goal is to help on the global level soon, I can't quite do that yet. However I don't want to sit idle; I'd rather help on the local level, even if the results are so small you have to look at it with a microscope :D. 

What Are We Doing?

It's the season for canned goods drive!  I love these drives, but while they're good for families who are needy and live in a home, my only problem with canned food is that it isn't very practical for homeless people. They don't have a kitchen to prepare the canned food in, and even if they are fine with eating cold green beans from a can when hunger strikes, what if they don't even have a can-opener?

So in a couple of weeks when winter break starts I'd love to get together with some friends to make blessing bags filled with items that are convenient for homeless to use. The bags will include things like nuts, granola bar, ready-to-eat canned goods with peel back lids, apples, bananas, bread, crackers, etc. If we can manage, it will also include miscellaneous necessities like tissues, inexpensive hats, etc. I will contact homeless shelters in my area to find the most apropriate place to either donate or distribute these bags. 

Let me know if you're in the area and would like to join! In fact, I want to throw a party out of the event and make mojitos+homemade chipotle burrito bowls for anyone who comes and brings items for the blessing bag! Open invitation!

What We Need 

We really don't need much. Hopefully my friends and I will be able to buy a decent amount of food ourselves. This funding campaign is here just in case anyone wants to help out but can't come make the bags with me. A dollar or two can help. You don't even have to donate! You can help out by making your own blessing bags at home and giving them out on your own time
