1 bps to 10 Mbps @ less than 0.2% baudrate error.
Hardware handshaking mode @ 1 bps to 5 Mbps.

Selectable number of stop bits (between 0.5, 1, 1.5 and 2 bits).
Synchronous master mode.

Tunnel mode. *

SPI - master only at the moment

11 bps to 20 Mbps @ less than 0.2% baudrate error. **

All 4 SPI modes.

Tunnel mode. *
Separate instruction for CS.


I2C
Standard and Fast Mode (SM & FM).

Allows you to violate the spec and go up to 1 Mbps in both SM and FM @ less than 0.14% baudrate error.
Bus sniffer.
Bus scanner.
Support for 7-bit addresses for now. 10-bit addresses planned.
Selectable pullups between 10k, 5k, 3.3k and 2.5k (combination of 5, 10 and the internal 10k one of the output buffer).
Separate start & stop instructions for more robust commands.


1-Wire

Standard mode for now, overdrive mode to come.
Bus sniffer.

Bus scanner.
Selectable pullups between 10k, 5k, 3.3k and 2.5k (combination of 5, 10 and the internal 10k one of the output buffer).
Can also send individual bits.

MicroWire
It's under development, at the moment it can only talk this protocol, with arbitrary number of bits per opcode (0-16), arbitrary number of bits per address (0-32) and arbitrary number of bits per data value.
LIN - needs transceiver, doesn't come with it

Bus sniffer.
Answer to custom header IDs with predefined messages.
Automatically adds parity bits when sending and also checks them in sniffing.

Smart Card - the ISO 7816-3 protocol

Supports both MSB and LSB communication.
T=0 implemented, T=1 in the works.
Reset instruction with built in control over the VCC line.
ATR interpretation.
Baudrate generation as a function of the clock.
PTS & APDU instructions.


Because of the programmable output level, the required voltage of the card can be detected by simply changing the output voltage of the proto-talk between the standard voltages at which smart cards can operate and running the reset instruction.

DHT
This family of sensors has grown into popularity lately, which is why I included them, I might move them in the future in a section dedicated to particular chips.

Can read the data from a DHT11 or DHT22 chip
Sniffer
Selectable pullups between 10k, 5k, 3.3k and 2.5k (combination of 5, 10 and the internal 10k one of the output buffer).


PWM
Rather useless with the current output buffers, since it can't drive any big load (like an LED) nor capacitive loads (like a filter - if the resistor is not big enough).
LCD - HD44780 Driver
It allows you to perform most of the functions of the LCD as well as providing a quick test routine.
Support only for the 4-bit mode at the moment, but I also plan to add support for 8-bit mode and sniffing for both modes (this is where the output buffers shine).
SD Card Slot & SDK
It also comes with a SD card slot that can be used to store programs and modules that proto-talk can run.
At this point I have managed to find files on the SD card, load them, run custom programs and implemented a basic SDK.
This functionality will be there, but it's low priority so I haven't even thought about a proper SDK structure or module structure.

* Subject to buffer overflow, as the incoming data may come in faster than the speed at which it's going out. A buffer overflow happens when there's incoming data, waiting to be processed, but the internal buffers are already full (with previous data).
** For SPI, the specified baudrate error of less than 0.2% is valid with one exception: 426 bps becomes 427 bps, which represents a baudrate error of 0.23%. In all other cases, the baudrate error is less than 0.18% (holds true for UART as well).


Possible Features


Most likely in future firmware updates (after the release date).
1) A rather certain feature is semi-direct port access, so new protocols can be implemented by bitbanging from user code.2) API for a binary mode, so the device can be switched into that mode and controlled via scripts or programs on the PC.3) Logic Analyzer. Even if the buffers are not making it ideal for this task and the little available memory would make it a rather useless LA (about 60 kb of RAM left for that), the fact is that it should still be able to sample data at up to about 40 Mbps. Not a real promise, but it's more than likely that this feature will make its way in there.
There are several things I didn't have enough time to look into, that I would like to add, but can't promise anything. If it is possible to add them, chances are they'll come in later firmware updates.
1) CAN. I took a quick look and it seemed complex enough to delay the launch of this campaign for too long. I postponed looking into it until more important things are done.
2) SD & MMC interface. This is something I'm very excited about and it's sort of top priority after all the basics are done. I went with the SPI mode for the built in SD Card slot because I wanted to have the native SDIO data lines free. They are routed to the two I/O ports of the proto-talk and the plan is to make it talk to cards and chips that talk the native SD / MMC protocol. This, coupled with the 1.2 to 5 V variable output level, could quickly morph it into a very nice and powerful recovery tool (for example for extracting data from broken phones and devices that have such chips).
3) Some sort of support for IR. (very low priority, unless requested by many users)

  What I Need & What You Get For this section, indiegogo is suggesting me to: 
Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

Let's start with the first one, why so much and where it's going:
For a breakdown:
- Most of it is going on components.- Another big chunk of it is going to the assembly house (they'll also handle the shipping).- I also expect to spend about 1k on boards with fast turnaround for the various changes I'll make.- At this point it looks like I may have to also buy an USB VID ($5000), which I'm not sure how to view, since it's both expensive enough to want to avoid it, but also useful enough to really want one. I'm doing my best to avoid it at the moment, but it doesn't look like it's going to happen.
This leaves us with a rather slim slice for me, which will serve as my motivation to continue working on proto-talk and deliver a finished product.
The way I see it, is that if this campaign gets successfully funded (the required number of devices get sold), it means there's enough interest for the device that I can keep producing it even after the campaign. What I'm trying to avoid is committing long-term, to a time sink that generates no income. I tried offering software for free and it stops being fun when you don't need it anymore, but other people do and they need you to keep working on it.
About: Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
I would hope that the specifications alone got you excited enough :) Personally I'm very excited about it, with or without this campaign.
If it will get overfunded by a lot, I will have to check with the manufacturer and see if I can throw in some additional external goodies. I never did this before, but I suspect it all comes down to the quantities.
About: Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.
It's fixed funding, so if the goal isn't reached, the funds go back into your pocket.

Delivery
I hope it will be ready much sooner, but after the ordeal I've been through with the first prototype board (got delayed by one month) and because we all make mistakes, I'm going to take 2 months after this campaign is funded to keep working on it, before going into production.
If everything goes fine and I'm confident that the hardware won't receive any more changes, it might get into production sooner, but things rarely go as you expect them to, so don't get your hopes up.
Another note worthy thing is that it will ship directly from China, so expect the kind of shipping times that the Chinese postal service is offering.
 Risks & Challenges
Being completely new to this, I can only imagine, but I suppose the worst thing that can happen is that nobody will receive their proto-talk. That's obviously not the plan, but hey... it happened before.
Aside from the risks that arise from working with a foreign assembly house and not being able to overview the entire process, I am only afraid of screwups in the design.
Because of that, I plan to get all the basic firmware features right first, in the idea that possible hardware issues might make themselves visible during this period as well as hardware requirements that I haven't foreseen for the design at hand.
I haven't talked about it with them yet, but I believe the assembly house can do a test run as well, so I'll do that and make sure that what comes out of the factory is at the expected quality.
You should also know that I was already quoted by the assembly house so I don't think there'll be any surprises there.
Given that this is an actual working prototype, I'd say the risks of me spending all the money on R&D are pretty slim :) If nothing goes horribly wrong, some layout changes will be in order and that's about it.
If I decide to try new output buffers and fail, I'll simply revert to the current design and live with the quirks of the current buffers as I described in the previous sections.

Edits
04-Oct-2014: The Smart Card mode was added.
05-Oct-2014: The baudrate errors were added for SPI & I2C and the SPI baudrate span was changed from "1 bps to 20 Mbps" to "11 bps to 20 Mbps".

  Ways You Can Help
I don't have a huge social network (actually I only have about 10 friends in my facebook account) and I don't like to spam either, so even if you don't have a use for this, but you know someone who might, please share this campaign with them.
Thank you,Razvan

story:
Summary

Many parts of Nepal faced continuous rain from 8-14th July, 2019. That was heavy rainfall and the lakes breached and flooded the habitations in southern part of Nepal. People have lost their houses and belongings. Low land of these districts remained under water with no electricity, communication and transportation system for several days. They need relief packages to survive, to regroup their energies and to re-build the damaged houses and come into the life again.

Solution

This project as an immediate relief & support is helping the victims to get the food & water packets, clothes, Toiletries, Mats, bed sheets, pillow, Basic medicinal kit (fever, headache, diarrhea pills, balm) etc. After immediate relief & support phase, this project will work on long-term recovery support including flood resilient community facilities.

Long-Term Impact

This project will support flood victims to fight against the scenario created by the floods every year. In long term, sustainable livelihood and disaster risk reduction interventions will take place in the areas of flood affected communities and the families.

In long term, sustainable livelihood and disaster risk reduction interventions will take place in the areas of flood affected communities and the families.

story:
Who We Are

We are “Dream Come True”, a group of five students from the University of Tennessee who have been given the opportunity to work with a non-profit through Beth Meredith’s public writing class at the university. Our group is working with The Dream Connection, a local non-profit to help make a child’s dream come true. The Dream Connection raises money to help support  children with life-threatening and chronicle debilitating illnesses to make his or her dream come true. 100% of the donated money will go towards fulfilling this child’s wish and we are looking for your support. 

    We have been paired with McKinley Greene, a four year old from East Tennessee battling Leukemia. Her dream is to go to Give Kids the World, an organization paired with Disney World. Mckinley loves Legos and helping fund tickets to Lego Land would be amazing!

 

What Is The Dream Connection?

The Dream Connection is a non-profit based in East Tennessee. Their mission is to grant a child’s one wish stating “‘once-in-a-lifetime dream come true’ of children between the ages of three and eighteen, with life-threatening or chronically debilitating illnesses in the East Tennessee community.” This non-profit is the only one of its kind belonging to this region and fulfills 20-30 wishes a year for the past 25 years. If you want to read more about children like McKinley or read more about The Dream Connection visit https://dreamconnection.org/wp/. 

 

What Is Give Kids The World?

Give Kids the World is a non-profit resort located in Central Florida. This organization is designed to create a memorable experience for children with chronic illness. Over the course of a week, children are able to participate in numerous fun-filled events and create memories for a lifetime. 

At this resort, the children and their families enjoy meals, transportation and passes to local parks such as Walt Disney World, SeaWorld and much more. Within the resort, the child and their family can enjoy numerous activities such as horseback riding, fishing, swimming, mini golf, arts and crafts and much more. No child is ever turned away, and the resort is completely cost-free. These experiences create a mental and physical escape from procedures, hospital visits and memories lost due to these life threatening illnesses.For more information on Give Kids The World Village, visit https://www.gktw.org. 

 

What Is Leukemia?

McKinley has Leukemia, cancer of the blood cells. Leukemia often involves the white blood cells which helps fight infections and other illnesses. The white blood cells are weakened and therefore your immune system becomes weak and you are more susceptible to get sick. There are fewer than 200,000 US cases a year and about 3,500 of those cases are children. Childhood cancer is scary, but can be treated! To learn more about Leukemia visit https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/.... 

Why Should You Care?

By making a contribution to our campaign, you will bring happiness and joy to a child who has experienced many difficulties throughout her life. McKinley is 4 years old and has been diagnosed with Leukemia. While this affects her life in a very difficult way she still loves to do everything a child loves to do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course donating to the Dream Connection helps us raise money for McKinley and help make her dreams come true, however sometimes you may not have the funds to donate and that’s ok! There are so many other ways you can help this organization, such as volunteering and spreading awareness! The more help this organization can get, the better the environment that can be made for the children. As a volunteer you would get to spend time with the kids and their families, help organize fundraisers, and create videos to advertise. The Dream Connection is always looking for help! Another way to be involved is through sharing the fundraisers, website, and information with others. This can be done in person or on social media! With just a click of a button, you can help make the dreams of many deserving children come true.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

The campaign is focused to invited you be part of this noble cause, help us to fulfill the objective and transmit the desire to give joy to those who need it most. "Give back the smile to Rodrigo" is focused  on collecting donations to buy a prosthesis for this child who needs it. It is important for us to show Rodrigo that he is not alone and with unity and solidarity his dream can come true. With their help together, we can return the smile to a child who needs it, motivate them to be happy and not feel limited with anyone.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need USD 2,000 dollars for the acquisition of his prosthesis that will help Rodrigo motivate his desire to live again. Giving back a smile, it's more than motivation to live, it's worth more than a thousand words and feeling part of it is much more exciting, then come with us to give love to a child, to be reborn their desire to fight and continue despite feeling part of the same society.

 

THE IMPACT

And if maybe you've never thought about it ... How would you feel if you lost a part of your hand? Put yourself in their place, nobody is free from any accident and that more than helping today you can do it, give and motivate someone who truly needs it. Let's be part of something good, of helping those who with their innocence can not understand because it is different and because it was born that way, we created a campaign today so you can access and leave a donation so that together we can reach the goal. In the plan that you can, you choose and you can bring joy to Rodrigo and many more children who need it.

 

The campaign is focused to will bring happiness to those who need it most, you will change the life of a child with a disability and you will give his a motivation to keep going.

Talk to your family, friends, partners, known as helping, spreading, creating love, happiness is part of the joy of a child who deserves to be happy.

story:
Short Summary

  • At-Risk Teens

We are partnering with the Department of Corrections to provide a structured system to rehabilitate teens, reintegrate them into society, and provide them with usable skills. Research has shown that it helps reduce the rate of repeat offenders and increase the graduation rate associated with At-Risk teens who participate in similar Equine programs.

  • Future Programs

We are working on providing therapeutic riding sessions for children with mental and physical disabilities, therapeutic riding for veterans, and a program for human trafficking victims.

What We Need

We need a total of $2.5 million dollars to get all the property, buildings, and start-up equipment needed to open the facility and begin taking on clients.

The projects that the donations would go towards would be: Clearing Pasture Ground, Purchasing 100 more acres, Fencing in New Pastures, and Building an Indoor Riding Arena

The Impact

Equine Therapy can improve social skills, physical skills, self-esteem, and concentration. It can help in the development of respect, responsibility, and perseverance. It also can reduce insecurities and fears, as well as assist in rehabilitation. Equine Therapy can assist with Phobias, Psychoses, Aggressiveness, Nervousness, Stress, Shyness, Insomnia, Sedentary Habits, Developmental Delays, Learning Disabilities, Social Problems, Neurological Motor Impairment, Cerebral Palsy, Vascular-cerebral Accidents, Cerebral Trauma, Down Syndrome, Autism, Sensory visual, Auditory or Speech problems, Posture, Equilibrium, Joint Degeneration, Injuries, Amputations, Congenital Defects, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Asthma, Bronchitis, Emphysema, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, and PTSD. Healing Hearts will also be involved in horse rescue and adoption. Some horses that are donated need rehabilitation and training. Our troubled teens will assist with integrating the horses into our program and in some cases nursing them back to health.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We also offer two sponsorship options if you would like to sponsor a horse or an individual in the program. You can do this through our Paypal link. https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xc... 
  • You can also help through volunteering. We are always in need of volunteers in many different positions. Volunteer options can range from: teaching skilled labor to At-Risk teens, working with horses, building fences, arenas, and stalls, assisting as horse walkers or side walkers for special needs children, future event planners, or assisting in fundraising.
  • Other Donations that are not monetary:

For Horses: Feed, Hay, Saddles, Saddle Pads, Halters, Lead Ropes, Bits, Bridles, Farrier Supplies, Supplements, Buckets, Cleaning Supplies, Brushes, Fly Spray, Blankets, Shavings, Vet Wrap, Ointment, Polo Wraps, Clippers, Manure Forks, Water Trough, Wheelbarrows, Sponsorship

For Youth: Muck Boots, Leather Gloves, Helmets, and Sponsorship

Misc: Snacks, Water Bottles, Lawn Chairs, Wood Rails, Wooden Round Posts, Screws, Photo Scrapbooks, Digital Camera, Money, Projector, Laptop

  • Praying and Spreading the word of our project is also a great way to support our cause.

story:
Why Mindfulness?

Mindfulness can be described as simply being present. It is a simple concept that can take a lot of practice to master. It has immense health benefits including reducing stress and increasing life positivity. It is our hope that The Purpose Pack will help people on that journey of being more present. The activities will help keep you active while being mindful and putting that idea into practice.

 

Activity Examples

Some examples of activities that will be featured in The Purpose Pack are a trophy to present to someone who has changed your life, cookie cutters to spend some time baking with loved ones, and crafting items to let you take a break.

 

Our Story

The Purpose Pack is the creation of Andy Boehnlein, Founder of The Average Unicorn. Andy founded the company as a way to merge his love for learning and laughing. He found a home on stage growing up and, after a dare from a friend, eventually wound up performing stand-up comedy at the University of Dayton. From there, he developed his comedy chops studying at The Second City in Chicago with their Comedy Studies Program.

George Scott Baker, DeMotivational Speaker, got his start on The Second City stage in Chicago, having three lines in a self-described terrible sketch. Upon entering graduate school, Andy started to ponder what George might have to say given more time. The mantra of ‘Why be perfect when you can be average?’ was born.

Andy and alter ego George have had the opportunity to travel around to various schools talking about the balance of stress and living a purposeful life. Andy learned the need for this balance first-hand after being so busy and stressed his junior year of college that he caused a physical reaction, twitching uncontrollably for six months, that he had to medically withdraw from school. It was through mindfulness and activities like the ones that will be included in the boxes that ultimately helped lead to his turnaround.

 

The Box

The Purpose Pack will be $12.99 for 1 month, $34.99 for 3 months and $69.99 for 6 months. All include free shipping!

Each box will feature an activity to complete and guided reflection questions.

Check out more information at thepurposepack.cratejoy.com

 

What will the money be used for?

The money pledged will be used to set up the business. This will include everything from purchasing boxes and packaging material to buying insurance.

Andy founded the company as a way to merge his love for learning and laughing. He found a home on stage growing up and, after a dare from a friend, eventually wound up performing stand-up comedy at the University of Dayton. From there, he developed his comedy chops studying at The Second City in Chicago with their Comedy Studies Program.George Scott Baker, DeMotivational Speaker, got his start on The Second City stage in Chicago, having three lines in a self-described terrible sketch. Upon entering graduate school, Andy started to ponder what George might have to say given more time. The mantra of ‘Why be perfect when you can be average?’ was born.Andy and alter ego George have had the opportunity to travel around to various schools talking about the balance of stress and living a purposeful life. Andy learned the need for this balance first-hand after being so busy and stressed his junior year of college that he caused a physical reaction, twitching uncontrollably for six months, that he had to medically withdraw from school. It was through mindfulness and activities like the ones that will be included in the boxes that ultimately helped lead to his turnaround. The BoxThe Purpose Pack will be $12.99 for 1 month, $34.99 for 3 months and $69.99 for 6 months. All include free shipping!Each box will feature an activity to complete and guided reflection questions.Check out more information at thepurposepack.cratejoy.com What will the money be used for?The money pledged will be used to set up the business. This will include everything from purchasing boxes and packaging material to buying insurance.

story: Hi! We are Special Students for Special Spaces. We are all students at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Our names are Neale Kemp, Makeila Smith, Adriana Jones, and Tyler O’Dell. We created this campaign in hopes of raising money for the organization Special Spaces. Special Spaces gives children with life-threatening illnesses their dream rooms; a place where they can relax after being at the hospital and just be a kid. Children going through treatments for their illnesses need a comfortable and inviting space to help them heal. There are studies that prove the environment that these children are in plays a big role in the healing process, and giving these children their dream room gives them a place that they can forget about their stressful day-to-day lives. We are specifically raising funds to go towards one of these room renovations for one of the children sponsored by Special Spaces. These children have been through so much in their short lives, and the least we can do is help to provide them with an environment that they love and promotes healing. For donating you can receive a gift basket including things like a koozie, magnet, and sticker from Special Spaces . Thank you so much for taking the time to look at our campaign. Help us let kids be kids.

story:
Why?

When I was 13 years old, I was certain I wanted to die. Life just seemed too heavy. It felt like someone had put a soaking wet blanket on top of me and I couldn't breathe. I couldn't see where the escape was. Hell, I couldn't see anything at all. I could only feel. Feel the tightness in my throat, the rapid beating of my heart that didn't feel right, the burn of tears behind my eyes, the desire to just stop. Stop trying, stop being scared, stop being sad, stop existing. 

I made it through this part of my life and it wouldn't be the last time I was absolutely sure that I didn't want to live anymore. Every time, something pushed me through it - a family member, a friend, a desire for something more.

Most recently, I've been burdened with new and scarier, but still similar feelings to those I had 11 years ago and a few other times since. Rediscovering and throwing myself into yoga practice has been like someone cut a hole in that wet blanket for me to breathe out of. Every time I go to a yoga class, that hole gets a little bit bigger and for the first time in my life, I see a way out of it. 

Yoga has served as a channel to get out the anxiety that tends to dominate my everyday, that electric energy flowing through me, threatening to shock me at any moment. By focusing on my movements, my poses, my breathing, I am being mindful and allowing those anxious thoughts to exist, but not consume me. Rather than pretending those thoughts don't exist, ultimately giving them more power over me, I am able to acknowledge them, then let them float away, shifting focus back into holding a pose or maintaining my breathing (or wiping sweat off my forehead because even not-hot yoga is more work than you think).

Yoga has given me a renewed appreciation for my body and my mind. It's so easy to go to a class and look at everyone practicing around me and think:

  • "Why can't I hold a balance for as long as they can?"
  • "Why can they do a split/handstand/weird pose I don't know and I can't?"
  • "How can they afford to wear all LuLuLemon to class and I'm rocking Target leggings?"

But once class starts and really gets going, I'm able to let that slip away. My intention for a class is almost always "appreciate your body and mind for what it can do today." And yoga has done just that for me - given me gratitude and grace for myself in a world that is hellbent on having us be hard on ourselves.

Enough about me though - how does this actually impact other people? Just because I have mental illness and needed help doesn't mean that everyone else does, right? Not quite.

  • 1 in 5 adults in the US have a mental health condition - that's more than the populations of Florida and New York combined.
  • Youth mental health is getting worse - percentage of youths with severe depression is increasing year over year, with 75% of those youth not getting sufficient treatment.
  • Women are almost twice as likely to have depression.
  • Depression increases as family income levels decrease.
  • 9.6 million people in the US experience suicidal ideations.

I want other people to find the self-worth, grace, calm, and resilience I've found through my practice and I want to help them do it. Once I get my certification, I'll be seeking opportunities to teach courses to populations that need it most, like those mentioned in the statistics above - women, young adults, low income populations, anyone suffering from mental illness - who also happen to typically be the people who can't afford it. (Yoga is expensive, people!! That's why I'm crowdfunding my certification!)

I'm a volunteer at InterAct, a non-profit in Raleigh that serves women and children that are victims of domestic and sexual abuse. Once certified, I'm going to work with the volunteer coordinators there to teach classes for InterAct's clients, who are most in need and deserving of grace and self-love. 

Long term, I'm hoping to identify a non-profit that will allow me to bring free yoga to young adults who struggle with mental illness because right now, there just aren't enough resources for them. There is a huge nationwide shortage of mental health professionals, which, compounded with rising medical costs and a general stigma around seeking treatment for mental illness, means that way to many young adults are struggling without help. They deserve a better quality of life and I want to do everything I can to give it to them. 

How?

As I mentioned, courses aren't cheap! They start at around $2,000 and can get up to $3,200+ when you include costs for books and additional yoga practice. Should you choose to contribute, your donation will go towards:

  • RYT-200 tuition
  • Any materials needed for the course (i.e. books)
  • Cost of shipping for any ~perks~ I'll be sending you

If somehow I exceed my goal, I will be donating any additional funds raised to Mental Health America. 

I want to clarify that my primary goal in getting this certification is to serve underprivileged communities, not to profit off of this certification. Since I don't plan to turn any real profit off of this for the time being, it's difficult to cover the cost on my own. I work full-time and have allllll the bills (just like everyone else, I know) so I don't have the time to pick up a full-on second job. My hope is that since I plan to give back to the community with this certification, that my community will invest in me first.

What?

I feel icky and weird about just asking people for donations so with each contribution you get a lil something back! I've outlined the ~perks~ per donation but please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have an idea for a different perk or an amount you don't see listed or would just rather venmo me. I'm definitely flexible (predisposed to be a yoga teacher, amirite? Sorry - bad joke). 

Oh, One More Thing!

If you can't contribute, I totally and completely understand - that's why I'm asking the community for help, because I feel that strain!

If you don't feel comfortable contributing financially, I also completely understand that - if you feel comfortable helping to spread the word about my campaign via social media/email/word of mouth, then that would be just as appreciated as a financial contribution.

And if you don't feel comfortable spreading the word, hey, I get that too - everyone has a brand to keep up on social media - please just send some positive vibes my way :) 

Thank you in advance for your consideration, kindness, and positive vibes!

Peace n blessings,

Casey

story:
Why Support Womb?

Would you like to follow the advice of your care providers, 'going with the flow' and not quite sure about you choices?

Or would you rather know why your midwife or doctor is suggesting a particular test, be fully aware of what all your options are and rock your birth by knowing in advance what is available to you?

If you are the latter - then you will want to support Womb. Womb is dedicated to providing unbiased information so that women can make informed pregnancy and birth choices. With your help, Womb can become a registered not-for-profit and have a comprehensive website built, complete with national maternity services directory.

 

The Impact

Womb wants to empower women and men.  Birth stories of women feeling that they were treated as simply bodies that produced a baby, are mounting.  More and more women are vocalising that their births were negative experiences, even traumatic. Some new fathers are also expressing shock at how their partners were treated. Experiences like this can lead to postnatal depression for both mums and dads. This is not a happy start to parenthood.

Pregnancy is a special time to learn and wonder about the little being growing inside. Birth is a magical moment when parents finally get to meet that new person for the first time. It should not be filled with feelings of doubt, helplessness and fear. With more information, women and couples can be in charge of the decision making and be active participants in the growth and birth of their child. Empowered women and men who have been supported by their care providers make for great new mothers and fathers!

Did you know that care varies between hospitals in the same city?

Womb intends to highlight these differences, that women and families can find the care that best suits their needs. For example, a woman who wishes to birth her breech baby naturally is more likely to achieve this if the hospital has trained staff who support it. Some public hospitals offer a homebirth option, while others don't. And some women will need specialised care that can only be provided by a specific hospital and highly trained staff. Knowing in advance what is available and where can alleviate a lot of stress and worry.

 

What Womb Needs

The financial goal of this campaign is based on the finances needed to create a not-for-profit and build an awesome website and directory. 

This is what the estimated set-up expenses for Womb looks like:

   ​

As you can see, the majority of expenses for setting up Womb are not actually building the website, but ensuring that it meets legal requirements and that it is a registered not-for-profit organisation. The total costs approximately come to $5000. 

What You Get​

Apart from feeling fantastic that you have helped a great initiative, there are a number of perks that you can purchase. Woo!

Read below for details of the larger offers, or peruse-the-perks on the right --->

SPONSORED PERKS: 

-- ADELAIDE: Clarity Massage and Wellness has provided a relaxing one hour massage for a lucky contributor. Valued at $105 **Please note this is a once-off perk and is available in ADELAIDE (North Adelaide) ONLY.

 

 

-- ADELAIDE: Adnilem Henna are offering a Maternity Design to celebrate your pregnancy, this is a great addition to a pregnancy photography session! Maternity Designs are unique and designed for each client, using organic henna made with lavender essential oil. Application is at their studio in One Tree Hill, ADELAIDE. Adnilem Henna recommends booking a maternity photo shoot 72hrs after application for the best photo opportunities. Bookings on average take 3hrs. Valued at $150 **Please note this is a once-off perk and is available in ADELAIDE (One Tree Hill) ONLY. https://www.facebook.com/AdnilemHennaArtist 

 

 

-- ADELAIDE: A maternity OR newborn photography session (1-2 hours) and print reveal with Jade Philp Photography (prints and images extra). Valued at $175 **Please note this is a once-off perk and is available in ADELAIDE (Barossa region) ONLY. https://www.jadephilp.com.au/

 

-- SYDNEY: Custom made picture framing for your pregnancy/newborn images. Look after your keepsakes with quality framing, thanks to Glebe Picture Frames. Valued at $200. **Please note this is a once-off perk and is available in SYDNEY (Glebe) ONLY.   http://glebepictureframes.com.au/

-- HOBART: A one hour maternity in-studio photography session, with Michael O'Keefe Photography. This voucher includes 20 digital images (prints extra) and is valued at $450. **Please note this is a once-off perk and is available in HOBART (Old Beach)  ONLY.  https://michaelokphotography.com

 

WOMB PERKS:

-- Pay it forward and purchase a bouquet of flowers to welcome a lucky new mum into the Womb Community! You choose the date, you choose the hospital, you choose the message. We send the flowers to an unsuspecting new mum! xx

-- A PDF of affirmations. Why get just birth affirmations, when you can have affirmations for pregnancy and early parenthood too?! 

-- The complete Womb birth package (PDF). Womb's complete series of birth templates, from Plan A to Plan Z. 

  • Plan A: planned vaginal and caesarean birth templates
  • Plan B: back-up plan for mum, when A (normal vaginal) is not possible
  • Plan C: birth options for expected preterm birth
  • Plan Z: birth plan for babies known to be born sleeping

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Think you can't contribute? You're wrong! Helping Womb finanicially isn't the only thing you can do. You can also:

  • Share this page to your facebook and twitter community
  • Talk about Womb with your friends (in person!)
  • Are you connected to the media? Ask your contact to run a story on this campaign
  • Are you the owner of a pregnancy service? Want to add a perk to the list? Please contact me! choice@womb.community

 

Thank You!

If you have made a contribution (financial or other) thank you so much!

Kahlia

story:
Go to  http://virustim.com for the latest developments.

 

Good for humanity but a bad business = Community backing needed

Although this is needed all over the world right now, there is no long term business potential. When people stop getting infected, VirusTIM will run out of customers.  This is why it needs to be a community project with your backing.

The problem: Coronavirus & COVID-19 

Our communities are overwhelmed by COVID-19. The disease caused by the coronavirus. It has forced us to shut down our economy, close our schools and is overwhelming our healthcare system. You are living the experience. I do not need to tell you about it.

The solution: VirusTIM (Contact Tracing and Isolation Management) 

In New Zealand, Taiwan, and China contact tracing and isolation management has shown to be very effective in slowing and stopping the spread of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. 

VirusTIM (Contact Tracing and Isolation Management) will automate and manage the process of contact tracing and isolation management with the use of a mobile smart phone app and a desktop application. The VirusTIM application will also manage the delivery of food, medicine and services to those who are sick in isolation but not sick enough to go to the hospital. Over 80% of people with COVID-19 do not need to be hospitalized, but many of these people need to be looked after in isolation because they either live alone or have high risk family members that they do not want to infect.

Contact tracing and isolation management requires a huge effort by a large number of people. People working in call centers, calling everyone who was in contact with a confirmed case and field support personnel who do testing, deliver meals, medicines and support to those in isolation. In the city of Wuhan, there were over 9,000 people doing contact tracing for just one city. Tens of thousands of people will be needed in the United States for many cities.

The United States is Failing in their contact tracing and isolation efforts. The US front line against the coronavirus is staffed by county health officials. It is their job to identify and isolate people who have been exposed to the coronavirus. The problem is that they do not have good tools and they have become overwhelmed with the number of cases. VirusTIM will help in managing the recruitment of large teams to do contact tracing and isolation management.

No other options are available to manage contact tracing and isolation. There are mobile apps available that do individual tracking. They use wireless Bluetooth to detect and record who is around them. Although these mobile apps are categorized as contact tracing they are actually tracking apps that may not be tolerated by Americans because of the invasion of privacy.

Why we need your support

In order for our economies to return to normal we need to take a more proactive approach to reducing the spread of the coronavirus. VirusTIM will help communities in their campaign against coronavirus. It does not make a good business proposition because when people stop getting infected it will run out of customers. For this reason it needs the backing of people in the community like you.

Other ways to support the project

One of the best ways to help us is by sharing our Indiegogo project page to your friends and institutions who will be interested in and want to support this project. If you would like to support this project in other ways. Please reach out to me here on Indiegogo.

Goals

Primary Goal: Raise 17K! - Basic Mobile and Desktop Application. This is a very low cost for a system consisting of both mobile and desktop applications. I set the primary goal low so that if there is little interest at least something will get done. In a basic way, it will work for doing contact tracing and isolation management. It will be available for future epidemics in any country on earth.

Basic website, desktop and mobile application for the management of tasks in support of contact tracing and isolation management.

  • Mobile and Desktop app with cloud code and website.
  • Ability to sign up users and patients.
  • Create and assign tasks to users.
  • Maintain a task summary for each patient.
  • Task reminders for patient service providers.

 

Stretch Goals

Stretch goal #1: Raise 50K! Extended Features and Offline Support. If we raise 50K, we will be able to create a fully featured system consisting of mobile and desktop application connected to the cloud for data storage. It will work offline during intermittent connection outages. (Necessary for rural and third world communities.) It will include wizards, management reports and automated communications.

  • Offline support so that the mobile application can continue to work when not connected to the Internet.
  • Wizard like questionnaire for the contact tracers to follow.
  • Progress reports for the desktop management application.

 

Stretch Goal #2 Raise 100K! THE NEED FOR SPEED! This is more realistic for an application of this size done fast! At this level of funding we can utilize our network of highly skilled outside contractors. The previous goals are based on doing much of the work in-house at a discount. Although a much lower cost, doing this project entirely in-house means it will take longer to finish. Using freelance contractors means it will get done much faster but more expensive.

Help documentation, training videos and multiple language support. Not only will we need to teach people how to use the apps. We will also need to teach them how to do contact tracing and isolation support services. Health Departments are not in a position to scale their personnel resources so we will need to create the training content for them.

Risks and challenges

Creating applications for contact tracing and isolation management is not an overly complex problem. It lacks a long term business model so businesses will not step up to the challenge. When people stop getting infected, VirusTIM will run out of customers. This is why it is best as a community backed project. I am confident in our ability to create the mobile, desktop and cloud components. Once completed VirusTIM will be the solution to managing large teams of contact tracers and people in isolation. I am confident that this project will work, but I also understand and acknowledge that there are always risks and challenges to any project and this isn't different. Despite our planning and utmost execution efforts, I understand that there might be circumstances that are out of our control. If we are met with these, I promise to be transparent and communicate them to you!
story_txt:
Go to  http://virustim.com for the latest developments.
 
Good for humanity but a bad business = Community backing needed
Although this is needed all over the world right now, there is no long term business potential. When people stop getting infected, VirusTIM will run out of customers.  This is why it needs to be a community project with your backing.
The problem: Coronavirus & COVID-19 
Our communities are overwhelmed by COVID-19. The disease caused by the coronavirus. It has forced us to shut down our economy, close our schools and is overwhelming our healthcare system. You are living the experience. I do not need to tell you about it.
The solution: VirusTIM (Contact Tracing and Isolation Management) 
In New Zealand, Taiwan, and China contact tracing and isolation management has shown to be very effective in slowing and stopping the spread of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. 
VirusTIM (Contact Tracing and Isolation Management) will automate and manage the process of contact tracing and isolation management with the use of a mobile smart phone app and a desktop application. The VirusTIM application will also manage the delivery of food, medicine and services to those who are sick in isolation but not sick enough to go to the hospital. Over 80% of people with COVID-19 do not need to be hospitalized, but many of these people need to be looked after in isolation because they either live alone or have high risk family members that they do not want to infect.

Contact tracing and isolation management requires a huge effort by a large number of people. People working in call centers, calling everyone who was in contact with a confirmed case and field support personnel who do testing, deliver meals, medicines and support to those in isolation. In the city of Wuhan, there were over 9,000 people doing contact tracing for just one city. Tens of thousands of people will be needed in the United States for many cities.
The United States is Failing in their contact tracing and isolation efforts. The US front line against the coronavirus is staffed by county health officials. It is their job to identify and isolate people who have been exposed to the coronavirus. The problem is that they do not have good tools and they have become overwhelmed with the number of cases. VirusTIM will help in managing the recruitment of large teams to do contact tracing and isolation management.
No other options are available to manage contact tracing and isolation. There are mobile apps available that do individual tracking. They use wireless Bluetooth to detect and record who is around them. Although these mobile apps are categorized as contact tracing they are actually tracking apps that may not be tolerated by Americans because of the invasion of privacy.
Why we need your support
In order for our economies to return to normal we need to take a more proactive approach to reducing the spread of the coronavirus. VirusTIM will help communities in their campaign against coronavirus. It does not make a good business proposition because when people stop getting infected it will run out of customers. For this reason it needs the backing of people in the community like you.
Other ways to support the project
One of the best ways to help us is by sharing our Indiegogo project page to your friends and institutions who will be interested in and want to support this project. If you would like to support this project in other ways. Please reach out to me here on Indiegogo.
Goals
Primary Goal: Raise 17K! - Basic Mobile and Desktop Application. This is a very low cost for a system consisting of both mobile and desktop applications. I set the primary goal low so that if there is little interest at least something will get done. In a basic way, it will work for doing contact tracing and isolation management. It will be available for future epidemics in any country on earth.
Basic website, desktop and mobile application for the management of tasks in support of contact tracing and isolation management.

Mobile and Desktop app with cloud code and website.
Ability to sign up users and patients.
Create and assign tasks to users.
Maintain a task summary for each patient.
Task reminders for patient service providers.

 
Stretch Goals
Stretch goal #1: Raise 50K! Extended Features and Offline Support. If we raise 50K, we will be able to create a fully featured system consisting of mobile and desktop application connected to the cloud for data storage. It will work offline during intermittent connection outages. (Necessary for rural and third world communities.) It will include wizards, management reports and automated communications.

Offline support so that the mobile application can continue to work when not connected to the Internet.
Wizard like questionnaire for the contact tracers to follow.
Progress reports for the desktop management application.

 
Stretch Goal #2 Raise 100K! THE NEED FOR SPEED! This is more realistic for an application of this size done fast! At this level of funding we can utilize our network of highly skilled outside contractors. The previous goals are based on doing much of the work in-house at a discount. Although a much lower cost, doing this project entirely in-house means it will take longer to finish. Using freelance contractors means it will get done much faster but more expensive.
Help documentation, training videos and multiple language support. Not only will we need to teach people how to use the apps. We will also need to teach them how to do contact tracing and isolation support services. Health Departments are not in a position to scale their personnel resources so we will need to create the training content for them.
Risks and challenges
Creating applications for contact tracing and isolation management is not an overly complex problem. It lacks a long term business model so businesses will not step up to the challenge. When people stop getting infected, VirusTIM will run out of customers. This is why it is best as a community backed project. I am confident in our ability to create the mobile, desktop and cloud components. Once completed VirusTIM will be the solution to managing large teams of contact tracers and people in isolation. I am confident that this project will work, but I also understand and acknowledge that there are always risks and challenges to any project and this isn't different. Despite our planning and utmost execution efforts, I understand that there might be circumstances that are out of our control. If we are met with these, I promise to be transparent and communicate them to you!

story:
As you may know already, Inubosaki Marine Park in Chiba, Japan shut down in January 2018. One bottlenose dolphin called Honey, 46 Humboldt penguins and hundreds of fish and reptiles have been left at the facility over a year. They have been fed at least, but the conditions they have been in are in such bad state that there is a high possibility Honey will not last long.

Because the park is privately owned, the government officials have done nothing but view the animals once a month which is very inadequate. Many people from all over the world have complained to them and asked to persuade the owner to release the animals ASAP, but so far our voices have not been heard. We (Mayumi Tanida / Tomoyo Tamatani / Amie Christine ) have decided to start raising funds so that we could negotiate with the owner about buying the animals.

If Honey is allowed to be transferred to a sanctuary overseas, we would like to arrange plans with those who also want to help her and help us. Our aim is to give her a better life, not for her to be moved to another aquarium and be used as entertainment for humans. Honey has already been through enough as a victim of the Taiji dolphin hunt and with enough care in a sanctuary perhaps one day she may be able to be released back into the ocean. We are planning to move the penguins and the rest of the animals to other facilities including overseas with the help of JAZA (Japanese Association of Zoos and Aquariums). Any updates will be posted later so that you can also follow this project.

Although Honey has been strong enough to survive all this, she and the others have no hope of escaping their desolate situation without your support. Every donation brings them one step closer to a better future, so please consider chipping in to save these poor animals!  Please also read our FAQs for more additional information.  

We are expecting the funds to reach $300,000 (USD) that will cover the price of the animals and any incurred costs to send Honey to a sanctuary. The fundraising period is set to 60 days. The remaining donations will be donated to animal welfare groups across the world. In case the funds do not reach our goal, donations will be refunded to you. Even though they reach our goal, the plan might not be carried out the way we expect. If this is the case, you can get a refund if you request, otherwise, your donation will be forwarded to the animal welfare groups across the world and details can be posted on the updates section. As for a refund, please read FAQ section for more details. You can also find us on Twitter (629 @TPNC629 ・Cockatoo @Cockato47613097) and many supporters through #FreeHoneyTheDolphin   #SaveHoneyTheDolphin and #savehoney  #イルカのハニー .

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this.  Please also consider sharing this campaign with your family, your friends, on social media and around you.

 

2018年1月の犬吠埼マリンパークの閉館に伴い、一頭のイルカ及び多数のペンギン、爬虫類、魚が一年以上も悲惨な飼育環境下の暮らしを強いられている事態は、TV・新聞等の報道で既にご存知の方も多いでしょう。この件は各国でも報道され、千葉県知事・銚子市長・環境省等に多数の抗議電話、メール等も届き、署名運動の結果も提出されましたが、依然として動物達の救出に向かう進展の気配はありません。

そこで私達( Mayumi Tanida / Tomoyo Tamatani / Amie Christine )は、募金活動の収益で動物達を犬吠埼マリンパークから購入する事が可能であると考え、皆様にもご協力をお願いする次第です。私達の最大の目的は、以前太地のイルカ漁で捕獲され、娯楽の為に水族館で使用された哀れなイルカのハニーを他の水族館へ移動させるのではなく、彼女の身体の状態が許す限り海外の愛護団体等の協力を得て、サンクチュアリへの移送を実現させる事です。私達はハニーが他の水族館へ移動する事はすなわち、彼女の残りの生涯が再び娯楽に使用されると定義し、それはハニーにとって不適切であると考えます。彼女もイルカが本来住むべき”海”で暮らす事を心から願っているはずです。ペンギン等はJAZAに協力を依頼し、日本/海外の水族館へ移送する予定です。Updates欄にて経過報告掲載を予定しておりますので、皆様にも確認して頂けます。

この募金の目標金額は $300,000 (米ドル) で、動物達の購入資金及びサンクチュアリへ移送するまでに生じる様々な費用に使われる予定です。募金設定期間は60日間です。余剰金は日本/海外の動物福祉団体へ寄付されます。募金目標額に達成しない場合は自動的に返金されます。仮に目標額に達成した場合、以上で述べた計画が予定通りに進展しない事も予想されます。その際、希望者には返金致します。残りの寄付金は日本/海外の動物福祉団体等へ再び寄付されます。進捗状況はその都度公表しますので、Updates欄やメールを忘れずに確認するようお願い致します。又、動物福祉団体・自然保護団体に限り、寄付希望の団体のリクエストも考慮します。寄付先・金額はレシートも添付の上、Updates欄にて公表します。返金について、詳しくはFAQをご覧ください。

犬吠埼マリンパークの動物達の救出に対する呼びかけは、ツイッターの#イルカのハニーや#savehoney  #FreeHoneyTheDolphin  #SaveHoneyTheDolphin 等でも大勢の応援者により行われています。この募金活動に対する質問等は私達のツイッターのアカウント (629 @TPNC629 ・Cockatoo @Cockato47613097) でも受け付けています。募金の趣旨にご理解とご賛同を頂き、是非、募金にご協力とご支援を頂きますようお願い申し上げます。

story:
The Canstruction Toronto event challenge is to build a structure made entirely of (canned) food, all of which is then donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank. All of the money you donate will go towards buying the food required to build our top-secret structure. We need to raise well over $6000 dollars to make our entry another huge success, and maximize the quality and quantity of the canned food which will be donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank.

Our past entries were huge successes - check out the ""MiCANaak" turtle pictured here, or the previous year's "BeaCAN Of Hope" Lighthouse! Though our entries won accolades for design and structural stability, the real prize is having raised over $3,800 in food donations last year alone. We love this event because it creates an opportunity for us to apply creativity, teamwork, and analytical problem solving in a fun event that benefits our community. We need your help to finance this year's entry. Your contribution will help provide relief to an ever-increasing hungry population in Toronto. We truly appreciate any support that you can offer to our campaign, whether it be a monetary donation, or making some noise about this event and passing along the info to your own contacts.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name is Olufemi Bakare, I am a Lagos based I.T professional in Nigeria. I am raising funds to support my wife's medical bills in excess of $12,000. We have exhausted our personal savings, our extended family's savings and have huge debts and loans to payback.

 

My wife Temitope fondly known as Temmy had a road traffic accident on the 29th of March, 2018. She fractured her right humerus (upper arm bone) alonngside other minor injuries.

 

Initially she underwent a surgery at Avon specialist hospital in Lagos called open reduction internal fixation (ORIF). A titanium plate was used to fix the bones in place. Shortly after the surgery, the suture site became infected. We battled the infection and after series of unsuccessful antibiotics treatment, her arm had to be re-operated upon for "debridement" and "wash out" on the 12th of May, 2018.

 

Post debridement, she endured severe pain by the second and numerous antibiotic injections; augumentin 1g IM & oral, rocephin IM, ceftazidime bestnum IM and ceftazidime fortum IM. None of this worked which led us to seeking second opinion(s).

 

We consulted with Ortho-surgeons at the Cedar Crest hospital in Abuja. After consultations with consultants, we were informed that her case had became a "septic non-union" fracture which meant the titanium plates had to be removed, an external fixation was implanted whilst the infection is controlled prior to extensive bone grafting surgery to reconstruct her right humerus. All her medical report and related pictures can be found here and here.

 

She is currently recovering from the surgery in the hospital with external fixation placed in her arm. We do not have a dime for the next surgery, as it is we can barely feed.

I want my wife to regain the use of her right hand and hopefully  be able to hold and carry our son again.

I appeal to you all for your help, please donate to SAVE TEMITOPE'S RIGHT HAND.

 

Every donation counts.

My wife Temitope fondly known as Temmy had a road traffic accident on the 29th of March, 2018. She fractured her right humerus (upper arm bone) alonngside other minor injuries.
 
Initially she underwent a surgery at Avon specialist hospital in Lagos called open reduction internal fixation (ORIF). A titanium plate was used to fix the bones in place. Shortly after the surgery, the suture site became infected. We battled the infection and after series of unsuccessful antibiotics treatment, her arm had to be re-operated upon for "debridement" and "wash out" on the 12th of May, 2018.
 
Post debridement, she endured severe pain by the second and numerous antibiotic injections; augumentin 1g IM & oral, rocephin IM, ceftazidime bestnum IM and ceftazidime fortum IM. None of this worked which led us to seeking second opinion(s).
 
We consulted with Ortho-surgeons at the Cedar Crest hospital in Abuja. After consultations with consultants, we were informed that her case had became a "septic non-union" fracture which meant the titanium plates had to be removed, an external fixation was implanted whilst the infection is controlled prior to extensive bone grafting surgery to reconstruct her right humerus. All her medical report and related pictures can be found here and here.
 
She is currently recovering from the surgery in the hospital with external fixation placed in her arm. We do not have a dime for the next surgery, as it is we can barely feed.
I want my wife to regain the use of her right hand and hopefully  be able to hold and carry our son again.
I appeal to you all for your help, please donate to SAVE TEMITOPE'S RIGHT HAND.
 
Every donation counts.

story:
Somos Johanna Hernández y Eduardo Sierra. Una pareja que comienza en el 2017 junto a unos amigos la idea de hacer un evento con información académica sobre veganismo, nutrición, activismo y la importancia que tiene actualmente para direccionar el impacto ambiental, de consumo y económico en el mundo. SALÓN SÉPTIMO SENTIDO inicio a finales de 2017 cuando empezamos a contactar a varios pensadores, académicos y profesionales nacionales e internacionales en Latinoamérica -especialmente de Chile y Argentina- y vimos su gran interés por venir a nuestro país Colombia y participar como conferencistas en este proyecto educativo sobre el tema. Actualmente los conferencistas, artistas, talleristas y expositores que van a participar están comprometidos con esta gran causa para exponer sus conocimientos para todas las personas además de sus múltiples seguidores. NECESITAMOS TU CONTRIBUCIÓN PARA HACER REAL ESTE SUEÑO DEL SALÓN SÉPTIMO SENTIDO 2018. Queremos fomentar a través de la educación este cambio positivo y sin duda ustedes son parte de él. Con su contribución vamos a hacer la Primera Edición del evento los días 3 y 4 de Noviembre 2018 e iniciaremos la planificación para la Segunda en el 2019.

Necesitamos $ 35,000 US. La contribución es para adquirir los boletos de avión de los diferentes conferencistas (Chile, Argentina y Colombia), alquilar el auditorio, organizar la producción del evento por 2 días con transmisión por streaming, apoyar un número limitado de emprendimientos con proyectos veganos y a los artistas musicales además de respaldar el marketing digital.

Cualquiera sea el monto que podamos recaudar se destinará al evento en su totalidad y nos permitirá apoyar su financiación. NUESTRO GRAN OBJETIVO ES HACERLO REALIDAD.

Hay tres motivos por lo que queremos realizar este evento educativo y son

1.    Dar información de cómo una dieta basada en plantas favorece notablemente tu salud e incluso previene y revierte múltiples enfermedades.

2.    Es una forma absolutamente sustentable de cuidar nuestros recursos naturales

3.    La empatía: nos damos cuenta que la capacidad de sentir de los animales es igual a la nuestra y por eso educamos para evitar su explotación.

Si estás en Colombia, no dudes en venir a Bogotá y sé parte de SALÓN SEPTIMO SENTIDO eres realmente importante para nosotros. Por favor comparte el proyecto con tu familia, tus amigos y tu comunidad. Para nosotros es fascinante tener la gran oportunidad de compartir esta experiencia con todos. El evento tendrá entrada libre y si no estás en el país, no te preocupes porque toda la agenda académica será trasmitida por streaming para todo el mundo.

Indiegogo nos está ayudando, mira todas las grandes cosas que tienen.

We are Johanna Hernández and Eduardo Sierra. A couple that begins in 2017 with some friends the idea of ​​making an event with academic information of veganism, nutrition, activism and the importance that it currently has to address the environmental  and economic impact on the world. SALÓN SÉPTIMO SENTIDO started at the end of 2017 when we started to contact several national and international  academic and professional Latin-American speakers,  from Chile and Argentina, we saw their great interest in coming to our country Colombia and participate as speakers in this educational project. Currently the speakers, artists, workshops and exhibitors who are going to participate are committed to this great cause to expose their knowledge to all people as well as their multiple followers. WE NEED YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO MAKE REAL THIS DREAM SALÓN SEPTIMO SENTIDO 2018. We want to promote this positive change through education and without a doubt you are part of it. With your contribution we will do the First Edition of the event on November 3 and 4, 2018 and we will begin planning for the Second of 2019.

 

We need $ 35,000 US. The contribution is to acquire the plane tickets of the different speakers (Chile, Argentina and Colombia), rent the auditorium, organize the production of the event for 2 days with streaming, support a limited number vegan projects and musical artist and also to support digital marketing. Whatever the amount we can collect will go to do the event and will allow us to support its funding. OUR GREAT OBJECTIVE IS TO MAKE IT REAL. There are three reasons why we want to carry out this educational event:

1. Give information on how a diet based on plants improves your health and even prevents and reverses multiple diseases.

2. It is an absolutely sustainable way of taking care of our natural resources

3. Empathy: we realize that the ability to feel of animals is equal to ours and that is why we educate to avoid exploitation.

If you are in Colombia, do not hesitate to come to Bogotá and be part of SALÓN SEPTIMO SENTIDO, you are really important to us.

Please share the project with your family, your friends and your community. For us it is fascinating to have the great opportunity to share this experience with everyone. The event will have free admission and if you are not in the country, do not worry because the entire academic agenda will be broadcast by streaming to everyone.   

 Indiegogo is helping us, look at all the great things they have.

story:
On Sunday September 30th 2018, over 120,000 distinguished gentlefolk in over 650 cities worldwide will don their cravats, tustle their ties, press their tweed, and sit astride their classic and vintage styled motorcycles to raise funds and awareness for men’s health, specifically prostate cancer and men's mental health.

 

The Distinguished Gentleman’s Ride was founded in Sydney, Australia by Mark Hawwa. It was inspired by a photo of Mad Men’s Don Draper astride a classic bike and wearing his finest suit. Mark decided a themed ride would be a great way to combat the often-negative stereotype of men on motorcycles, whilst connecting niche motorcycle communities together. 

That first ride in 2012 brought together over 2,500 riders across 64 cities. The success of the event encouraged the founder to consider how it could be used to support a worthy cause.

Influenced by the tragedy of losing one of our ride hosts to depression, from 2016 we have seen a change in our health fundraising goals. Now, the funding of men's mental health programs is a Distinguished Gentleman's Ride focus, in addition to prostate cancer research through our new official charity partner The Movember Foundation and the support of our title sponsors Triumph Motorcycles and Zenith Watches.

The Distinguished Gentleman’s Ride is a celebration of the art of being dapper and classic custom motorcycles.

What does that mean, you ask?

Dress: Tailored suits, silk waistcoats, crisp shirts, stylish caps and polished brogues.

Ride: Cafe' Racer, Bobber, Classic, Tracker, Scrambler, Old School Chopper, Modern Classic, Sidecar, Classic Scooter, Brat Styled motorcycles. Visit our style guide to check out the bikes that make The Distinguished Gentleman’s the unique event that it is.

Do: Bring your finest manners, your most dashing drapes, a sense of fun, and a smile.

Pay: We encourage those riding to make a donation to support the cause, as well reach out to friends, family, and colleagues to donate via your personal fundraising page.

Register: To set up your personal fundraising page and register for your nearest ride, visit www.gentlemansride.com/register

A number of companies operate a fund-matching programme, meaning that the money you fundraise is doubled by them. Check with your HR department to see what your company policy is around fund matching and what you need to do next to qualify.

story:
Hairy Henry is a real horse – and also the name of our Therapeutic Riding Centre. We started our work in 2013 and have been reaching out to many families since and been able to support them.

We have three horses and a pony, and together with some volunteers, we make a therapy team. This team is for people of all ages – but mostly children – who have special needs due to Autism or ADHD. They often struggle in school, and so they come and visit us here on our tiny farm in the west of Ireland, and spend time working with the horses.

Therapeutic Riding can literally mean riding - with or without a saddle - but sometimes it’s more appropriate to just do some brushing, or sorting out the hay or playing games while you’re on the horse. Whatever suits best. And whatever we do, a relationship is built between the child and the horse – a relationship of trust and respect.

Hairy Henry, Flora, Winnie and Daisy are incredible horses. They are gentle and patient and they help the child achieve their goals, whatever extra needs he or she has. That’s a really powerful experience to have if you’re young and struggling with life – to have a huge, hairy, strong, soft, warm horse on your side. It means a lot to our clients, and they often spend the session laughing and learning and gaining skills - and their confidence grows with each session.

We don’t get any financial support from anywhere, and we can’t charge much for the sessions, so we’re always strapped for cash. These little bottle-openers are a way for us to spread the word about what we do and, if we’re successful with the campaign, earn a little money too.

Our work carries with it large overheads - all animals need to be fed even if they don't work, and they need care and medical attention and equipment. With the wet weather continuing into spring, and all our work taking place outdoors, it can be hard going at times.

By supporting this campaign, you will help us make our work more widely known and support us to keep going into summer and beyond.

But you won't only support Hairy Henry and what we do here – not at all! These bottle openers are art pieces that Tim designed and makes in his workshop - and we’re proud of them. And of course, they open bottles too!

They're made of steel, polished smooth and then waxed. That's it - nothing fancy, just a good-looking functional friendly design. We hope you like it : -  )

So, please spread the word about our campaign amongst your friends and share!
