story:
Who Are We?

We are four students enrolled in a public writing class at the University of Tennessee. As a group we were given the task of creating a campaign to help raise funds for The Love Kitchen, hence why we call ourselves the Campaign Cooks. Here is a video that explains exactly what our goal is by this campaign.

https://www.wbir.com/article/life/food/campaign-cooks-four-ut-students-are-stepping-up-to-give-back-and-help-feed-knoxville/51-cf938fb9-6fb0-42e0-8ab1-8ed3acd04236

The Love Kitchen is a local organization that devotes itself to helping those in need throughout the community of Knoxville. This organization is important to us because they provide those struggling with meals, clothes, and emergency packages. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, there are now more people struggling that need help and can benefit from your donations. If you would like to learn even more about The Love Kitchen, a link will be provided below.

 https://thelovekitchen.org/

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise a total of 1,000 dollars to give directly to The Love Kitchen itself. The Love Kitchen is a local Knoxville non-profit that is solely run by volunteers and donations. They rely on your help to stay open and help the needy of Knoxville. The Love Kitchen has been open and serving the community  for 35 years. We are so proud to say that we are supporting such a trustworthy and stable organization.

By donating to our campaign, you will not only have the satisfaction of knowing you are supporting a worthy cause but you will also get a perk in return! These perks will consist of items from The University of Tennessee’s Volshop or even a coupon to a free meal at one of the local restaurants right here in Knoxville! 

Of course we hope and anticipate that we will reach our goal. However, if this is not the case, any money we do raise will still go directly to The Love Kitchen. Any amount of money raised is appreciated by both our group and The Love Kitchen because at the end of the day the money is going to a great cause.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

The Love Kitchen plays a very special role in the community of Knoxville. With your contributions, you will be helping clothe, feed, and support people and families that are much less fortunate. 

This organization was brought about in 1984, by Helen and Ellen Ashe. Both women set their mission to Help feed God’s children. To do this, they began to provide meals, clothing and emergency food packages to the homeless, homebound, and the unemployed citizens in the community of Knoxville. This organization has no paid staff, and all donations go directly to those who need it most. The main goal that this organization strives to achieve is to “provide nourishment for anyone who is hungry and to establish a community center to serve as a support system for children and their families”.

 

Risks & Challenges

Due to the fact that we are living in the midst of a pandemic, volunteering and donating physical items can be extremely difficult. This is why we have chosen to carry out this campaign through the online website Indiegogo. By doing this, everything can be done virtually without the risk of exposure to Covid-19. However, if you decide you feel comfortable enough to volunteer in person at The Love Kitchen make sure to abide by proper social distancing guidelines and mask mandates as well as ensuring you have zero symptoms related to Covid-19. Whether you decide to go in person or donate online, we appreciate your contribution to The Love Kitchen in any way. If you have any questions on how to better protect yourself and others regarding Covid-19 we have provided a link to the current Knox county regulations https://covid.knoxcountytn.gov/ .

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in other means of making an impact, donating money is not the only option:

The Love Kitchen accepts donations in the form of canned goods, dry goods, and toiletries. All of the donations will be used to support those who truly need it. Below is a link of needed items at the moment https://thelovekitchen.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/food_items.pdf

At The Love Kitchen, you are able to volunteer your time to help with food preparation, sorting incoming donations, and setting up for lunches. Over 1,200 people are engaged volunteers. 

Companies and other organizations can team up with The Love Kitchen and sponsor food drives or fundraisers. With the help of your volunteers and donations, The Love Kitchen is able to feed and clothe the ones who need it most.

As a group we were given the task of creating a campaign to help raise funds for The Love Kitchen, hence why we call ourselves the Campaign Cooks. Here is a video that explains exactly what our goal is by this campaign.https://www.wbir.com/article/life/food/campaign-cooks-four-ut-students-are-stepping-up-to-give-back-and-help-feed-knoxville/51-cf938fb9-6fb0-42e0-8ab1-8ed3acd04236The Love Kitchen is a local organization that devotes itself to helping those in need throughout the community of Knoxville. This organization is important to us because they provide those struggling with meals, clothes, and emergency packages. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, there are now more people struggling that need help and can benefit from your donations. If you would like to learn even more about The Love Kitchen, a link will be provided below. https://thelovekitchen.org/What We Need & What You GetOur goal is to raise a total of 1,000 dollars to give directly to The Love Kitchen itself. The Love Kitchen is a local Knoxville non-profit that is solely run by volunteers and donations. They rely on your help to stay open and help the needy of Knoxville. The Love Kitchen has been open and serving the community  for 35 years. We are so proud to say that we are supporting such a trustworthy and stable organization.By donating to our campaign, you will not only have the satisfaction of knowing you are supporting a worthy cause but you will also get a perk in return! These perks will consist of items from The University of Tennessee’s Volshop or even a coupon to a free meal at one of the local restaurants right here in Knoxville! Of course we hope and anticipate that we will reach our goal. However, if this is not the case, any money we do raise will still go directly to The Love Kitchen. Any amount of money raised is appreciated by both our group and The Love Kitchen because at the end of the day the money is going to a great cause.The ImpactFeel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:The Love Kitchen plays a very special role in the community of Knoxville. With your contributions, you will be helping clothe, feed, and support people and families that are much less fortunate. This organization was brought about in 1984, by Helen and Ellen Ashe. Both women set their mission to Help feed God’s children. To do this, they began to provide meals, clothing and emergency food packages to the homeless, homebound, and the unemployed citizens in the community of Knoxville. This organization has no paid staff, and all donations go directly to those who need it most. The main goal that this organization strives to achieve is to “provide nourishment for anyone who is hungry and to establish a community center to serve as a support system for children and their families”. Risks & ChallengesDue to the fact that we are living in the midst of a pandemic, volunteering and donating physical items can be extremely difficult. This is why we have chosen to carry out this campaign through the online website Indiegogo. By doing this, everything can be done virtually without the risk of exposure to Covid-19. However, if you decide you feel comfortable enough to volunteer in person at The Love Kitchen make sure to abide by proper social distancing guidelines and mask mandates as well as ensuring you have zero symptoms related to Covid-19. Whether you decide to go in person or donate online, we appreciate your contribution to The Love Kitchen in any way. If you have any questions on how to better protect yourself and others regarding Covid-19 we have provided a link to the current Knox county regulations https://covid.knoxcountytn.gov/ . Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are interested in other means of making an impact, donating money is not the only option:The Love Kitchen accepts donations in the form of canned goods, dry goods, and toiletries. All of the donations will be used to support those who truly need it. Below is a link of needed items at the moment https://thelovekitchen.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/food_items.pdfAt The Love Kitchen, you are able to volunteer your time to help with food preparation, sorting incoming donations, and setting up for lunches. Over 1,200 people are engaged volunteers. Companies and other organizations can team up with The Love Kitchen and sponsor food drives or fundraisers. With the help of your volunteers and donations, The Love Kitchen is able to feed and clothe the ones who need it most.

story:
Overview

We, “Put a Fork in Hunger”, are advocating for Smokey’s Pantry, a food pantry located in our campus. Smokey’s Pantry receives donations from Tyson House Student Foundation and UTK Grow Lab. They need your help to continue their altruism and alter the perception and importance of food insecurity in Knoxville. All donations will go toward their operational expenses and advertising. Any contribution is accepted with open arms. Even change can make a change.

Who We Are

We are “Put a Fork in Hunger”, a group of students from the University of Tennessee Knoxville. Our goal is to help raise funds for our on-campus food pantry, Smokey’s Pantry. Together we “can” make a difference -- every student and community member at a time. 

We all believe that food insecurity and accessible, nourishing food is important. Putting food in everyone’s hands, regardless of their race, sexual orientation, ethnicity, social class, etc., greatly impacts our community. This is a mission statement both we and Smokey’s Pantry can attest to. 

About Smokey's Pantry

Smokey’s Pantry is the first food pantry at the University of Tennessee Knoxville, located right on the campus at the end of Lake Avenue adjacent to academic buildings. They opened in 2016 in collaboration with FISH Hospitality Pantries, Student Government Association, and Tyson House Student Foundation.

They are growing at a fast rate. People from across the Knoxville area continuously rely on their generosity day-to-day, week-to-week, year-to-year. 

Why Smokey's Pantry

Smokey’s Pantry is unique because it does not ask for proof of need but rather gives to anyone in the UTK community who may be in need. This includes students, faculty, and staff. Smokey’s Pantry truly takes a progressive, nonjudgmental stance on social improvement, notably food insecurity. Their secular attitudes stand out.

“Everyone is welcome at Smokey’s Pantry, and we take absolutely no qualifying information (such as financial information, identification, etc.) for you to receive food!” (smokeyspantry.com).

Smokey’s Pantry supports the well-being of Knoxville. When you donate, you are helping the entire community. 

Why Should You Carrot (Care)

From choosing ramen over quality meals and going long hours or even days without proper nutrition, Smokey’s Pantry is here to help. Food insecurity is toxic and far too prevalent. It is estimated that over 50 percent of college students suffer from this social issue. 

It’s widespread, yet an overlooked problem -- not anymore. Nearly every college student faces food insecurity. Poor grades, bad temperament, and substandard diets are the effects. Without access and knowledge of food and its true importance, potential oftentimes isn’t reached. 

Additionally, food insecurity and starvation touch homeless and low socioeconomic individuals. When food and money are scarce, crime and unhealthiness come into play. Smokey’s Pantry helps diminish this reality. 

What Your “Green” Goes Towards

Broadly, donations to Smokey's Pantry will go towards operational costs: how food is received; how much food is received; workers’ needs. Every contribution provides another meal to someone in need. 

Donations will also provide advertising. The pantry needs to spread its word across the community. People need to know not just what food insecurity is, but how Smokey’s Pantry can help.

Moreover, a fraction of the contributions will go towards toiletries, a resource lacking from FISH, their primary donor. Toiletries are vital to health -- although they do not influence food insecurity.  

Through crowdfunding, we believe that our 1000 dollar goal will be achievable. 

Breaking It Down, Lettuce Talk About It 

“Some 795 million people in the world do not have enough food to lead a healthy active life. That's about one in nine people on earth. The vast majority of the world's hungry people live in developing countries, where 12.9 percent of the population is undernourished.” (foodaidfoundation.org). 

Roughly 42 million people in the United States suffer from food insecurity -- undernourishment. The predominant population of food insecure people are college students. It is a real problem, one that requires real change. 

In accordance, food pantries and food co-ops provide continual support. Without their guidance and accessibility, many college students, particularly those here at UTK, would go hungry. 

Challenges We Have       

There are plenty of challenges, time being the most substantial. Our campaign is restricted to only one semester. All of the planning, drafting, operating and crowdfunding are confined to 3 months. Accordingly, attempting to cram all of that into a small time frame is very difficult. Additionally, funding, resources and perks will be challenging to obtain with the wide variety of pantries in the Knoxville area. 

Other Ways To Kelp (Help)

There are many other ways to help! Donate to other FISH Hospitality Pantries across Knoxville. Come and bring individual contributions to Smokey’s Pantry every Tuesday from 4-6 p.m.  

Feel free to volunteer as well at Smokey’s Pantry or other UTK-related organizations. Your time, while precious, will go a long way to helping those in dire need. 

Sources: 

“About Us.” Smokey's Pantry, 2016, www.smokeyspantry.com.

“World Hunger Statistics.” Food Aid Foundation, 

www.foodaidfoundation.org/world-hunger-statisti.... 

Writer, DIANE D’AMICOStaff. “How Colleges Deal with Food Insecurity on Campus.” 

Press of Atlantic City, 3 May 2017, www.pressofatlanticcity.com/news/how-colleges-d.... Image Source

story:
Nuestra historia

Somos el grupo de atletas que irá a representar a Panamá en el campeonato mundial del ISKA - International Sport Karate and Kickboxing Association, en la disciplina de muay thai. Esta competencia se realizará en Kiev, Ucrania, del 2 al 8 de junio 2018, y salimos de viaje desde el 27 de mayo para aclimatarnos. Vamos con el fin de demostrar que la Selección Nacional de Muay thai de Panamá se perfila a nivel mundial, lo cual fue demostrado en ediciones anteriores con 3 campeones del mundo, y un campeón panamericano.

Fundado en 1986, el ISKA es considerado como autoridad reguladora en las artes marciales y deportes de combate, promoviendo atletas y escuelas de renombre en sus varias modalidades. Ha alcanzado su estatus internacional a través de su compromiso al deporte, credibilidad e integridad.

Nuestra academia es Panamá Muay Thai Academy, situada en panamá viejo justo en frente a la estatua de Morelos.  Nuestro equipo de competición tiene integrantes profesionales, trabajadores, estudiantes y de todas las edades. Las clases son mixtas, competidores con iniciados y profesionales con entusiastas como una gran familia deportista.

Porqué es importante para nosotros

Celebramos el desafío por medio de la competición sana, desarrollamos la superación personal en equipo, y honramos la amistad estrechada por los lazos de un objetivo común. Somos apasionados por nuestro deporte y compartimos, diariamente, los ritmos de la disciplina y entrega constantes de ser atleta y trabajador, atleta y estudiante o atleta y padre de familia.

Queremos ser ejemplo para futuros atletas, ayudando a impulsar un Panamá más sano. Nuestras aventuras y crecimiento en competencias nacionales e internacionales son historias de superación y amistad, y deseamos compartirlo con todos, dejando el camino para que más atletas puedan proyectarse y aprender.

Nuestro objetivo

Queremos dejar nuevamente a Panamá en el pódium mundial de la modalidad que disfrutamos y que nos mueve, une y emociona – el muay thai.

Tenemos el reconocimiento gubernamental de Pandeportes, quienes nos respaldan formalmente como asociación prestigiada, sin embargo, los gastos sufragados están siendo complementados por cada uno de los atletas. A pesar de los esfuerzos de cada uno, nos vemos en la necesidad de solicitar apoyo ya que no hemos alcanzado la cifra necesaria para lograr este proyecto.

El apoyo económico brindado será para solventar los costos de alojamiento, inscripciones y transporte de los atletas durante el viaje. Esto se refleja en pasajes aéreos, conexiones, boletines e documentación de registro en el evento organizado por el ISKA, aparte de un lugar donde dormir, comer y entrenar durante el tiempo que estaremos compitiendo.

Un poco más a fondo – viajar & competir

Cada viaje en equipo es una prueba colectiva de hermandad, resistencia y apoyo. Salir en representación de nuestra bandera, es, además de traerla en el corazón, toda una rutina de enfoque y sacrifico. Como los demás deportes de combate, competimos en categorías de peso por lo que debemos mantenernos en nuestros escalones corriendo y entrenando diariamente, descansando y alimentándonos saludablemente. Al subirnos al ringue, el peso del equipo y la sinergia que se amplifica durante el viaje nos une y fortalece más. Esa complicidad nos da la confianza de avanzar y conquistar cada victoria.

Junto con Panamá Muay Thai Academy y la Asociación de Kickboxing Profesional de Panamá, pretendemos ser buen ejemplo e inspiración para quienes tengan el sueño de pelear por Panamá.  

Quienes somos:

  • Adrián Almeida 67kgs (atleta juvenil)
  • Alexanders Russell 76kgs
  • Benedicto Chang 60kgs
  • César Monteza 57kgs
  • Christian Cardenas 71kgs
  • Carlos Peralta 81kgs
  • Luis C Arias 67kgs
  • Moisés Santizo 67kgs
  • Orestes Cruz 71kgs
  • Sofia B Carles 53kgs
  • Yani Castrellón  53kgs

Por fin,

Gracias por creer en nuestro desafío y por colaborar. Si no puedes colaborar, ayúdanos en compartir esta campaña en tus redes, con tu familia o tus colaboradores, visítanos en nuestra academia! Recuerda que cada granito de arena cuenta! Un saludo

story:
Visits for John and his Community

John and I met over a year ago in a senior care community. As a software engineer, I was connected with John to help him learn how to use a tablet that he received as a gift. What began as lessons to use his new tablet continued into a genuine friendship. We bonded over our shared interest in technology, and built a relationship over countless conversations and football games every Saturday and Sunday afternoon. Since meeting John I have not missed visiting him on holidays or attending his special events. 

Not only has my visits with John halted, visits with his sister were stopped as well as the result of COVID-19. With the recent need to restrict visitation and existing high risks for loneliness in senior care communities, a solution to continue social interactions in senior care communities was my top priority.

Helping others with limited technology resources

Frustrated with the effects of the COVID-19 and knowing the connection between social interaction and health, I knew that there could be a way to combat social isolation with the use of technology. Being an engineer, I put together an application that would allow residents in John’s senior care communities and their families to stay connected.

After seeing the impact that being able to connect with family had on John and other residents, I thought of other communities that are currently experiencing visitation bans. It became my mission to help connect others in senior care communities in the Atlanta area as well. 

This is why the See You Soon Foundation exists. The foundation’s mission is to collaborate with families, healthcare professionals, and members of the community to maintain social connectedness within senior living communities.

         

Your contribution will help provide unique technology that will connect loved ones in senior care communities to family and friends. This technology includes an iPad, a stand to assist individuals with limited mobility, and access to the software I designed specifically for senior care communities. 

Risks & Challenges

There were many hurdles that I had to overcome to ensure that I was successful at achieving this goal. One of the biggest obstacles was creating a system that is user friendly and not time consuming for senior care community staff. As a software engineer, I took this and many other factors into considerations when building the app.

With healthcare having its own set of tasks, I wanted to make certain that there was no disruption to the normal routines of the community healthcare workers. To address this, I created a user-friendly app that allows a seamless visit from family members being able to schedule a visit to healthcare staff connecting the call.

I have already invested both time and funds into making this unique technology available to a senior care community. I have addressed issues that were not initially visible and added additional features that I identified as enhancements. 

Since this unique technology is beyond the prototype stage, I am able to provide it with confidence to other senior care communities. As more senior care communities are added, I will share updates along the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that this is a difficult time for many.

If you are unable to contribute, please consider sharing this campaign to others and posting it on your social media platforms.

story:
Hey everybody,

I have waited a while to talk about this because I wasn't sure it was going to happen. The approval came through. I am getting a new wheelchair. That is very awesome. However I do want to vent for a minute. I'm not sure if you are all aware but a new power wheelchair is right around 50 grand. Here's where things get a little tricky. Medicare will cover most of the chair. In fact nowadays they will even give you the ability to turn your wheelchair into a freaking La-Z-Boy. I will be able to drive around with my feet up. That's cool I'm not sure i will actually use it but maybe I will. The one piece of the chair that I use the most puts me at the level of a countertop or raises me up so I am at a level with most humans. Seems like a no brainer right however Medicare will not pay for that functionality they don't feel it is necessary for independence. I know that most of you take for granted that you were at I level with everybody else but when you sit in a chair you're always having to look up at people. The elevation feature is a $1850 out-of-pocket expense. There may be some people out there that will say will just deal with it. I'll tell you what why don't you sit in a chair next to your coffee pot and try to put water in it without standing up.

OK everybody this is super hard for me. If you are willing to donate I would appreciate it. The total I have to cover is 1,850.
story_txt:
Hey everybody,
I have waited a while to talk about this because I wasn't sure it was going to happen. The approval came through. I am getting a new wheelchair. That is very awesome. However I do want to vent for a minute. I'm not sure if you are all aware but a new power wheelchair is right around 50 grand. Here's where things get a little tricky. Medicare will cover most of the chair. In fact nowadays they will even give you the ability to turn your wheelchair into a freaking La-Z-Boy. I will be able to drive around with my feet up. That's cool I'm not sure i will actually use it but maybe I will. The one piece of the chair that I use the most puts me at the level of a countertop or raises me up so I am at a level with most humans. Seems like a no brainer right however Medicare will not pay for that functionality they don't feel it is necessary for independence. I know that most of you take for granted that you were at I level with everybody else but when you sit in a chair you're always having to look up at people. The elevation feature is a $1850 out-of-pocket expense. There may be some people out there that will say will just deal with it. I'll tell you what why don't you sit in a chair next to your coffee pot and try to put water in it without standing up.
OK everybody this is super hard for me. If you are willing to donate I would appreciate it. The total I have to cover is 1,850.

story:
Por qué Enviro Sound

Mi nombre es Paco Valverde (https://pacovalverde.com) desde siempre me han gustado las nuevas tecnologías. En concreto la electrónica y la programación web. Tengo varios proyectos pendientes por realizar y quiero probar el crowdfunding para llevarlos a cabo. Para este proyecto cuento con la colaboración de unos amigos. Otro programador y un diseñador web.

En este caso se trata de un proyecto pequeño que quise realizar por un pequeño problema que tengo con la tinnitus (acúfenos). Un pitido continuo en los oídos que no deja concentrarse bien a menos que tengas algún sonido externo que lo amortigüe.

Vuestra colaboración permitirá que la web esté en funcionamiento y con mejoras durante mucho tiempo. Permitiendo, también, desarrollar una personalización para que los usuarios puedan subir sus propios sonidos y fondos de pantalla.
Además, de la acogida que tenga este proyecto podremos desarrollar otro mucho más ambiciosos de diversa índole.

Necesidades
Se deben pagar hosting y dominio para al menos dos años. Si lo recaudado cubre el sueldo a tiempo parcial de tres desarrolladores web podremos plantearnos realizar otros seis proyectos que tenemos planeados.

Recompensas

  • Ayuda al hosting (4 €)

Estás ayudando a que el hosting del proyecto tenga un alojamiento cada mes.
Tendrás derecho a subir tus seis propios sonidos cíclicos, seis sonidos esporádicos y seis fondos de pantalla.
Aparecerás en los créditos de la web cómo colaborador estandard.

  • Ayuda al dominio (12 €)

Estás ayudando a que la web tenga un nombre de dominio anualmente.
Tendrás derecho a subir un máximo de veinte sonidos personalizados y veinte fondos de pantalla.
Aparecerás en los créditos de la web cómo colaborador estandard.

  • Ayuda a los programadores (50 €)

Ayudas al programador a desarrollar su trabajo.
Tus sonidos  y fondos de pantalla (hasta veinte) son incluidos por defecto en la web en una sección para este tipo de crowdfunders con tu nombre o nick y un enlace a tu web o red social.
Aparecerás en los créditos cómo "Excelente".

  • Ayuda a los diseñadores (50 €)

Ayudas al diseñador a desarrollar su trabajo.
Tus sonidos  y fondos de pantalla (hasta veinte) son incluidos por defecto en la web en una sección para este tipo de crowdfunders con tu nombre o nick y un enlace a tu web o red social.
Aparecerás en los créditos cómo "Excelente".

  • Ayuda al equipo (200 €)

Ayudas a todo el equipo en este proyecto y en el planteamiento de próximos proyectos.
Tendrás una opción de la web que irá a tu sección exclusiva. Con tus sonidos, fondos de pantalla y enlaces a tu web y/o redes sociales.
Aparecerás en los créditos cómo "Cum laude".


En caso de no recaudar toda la cantidad será destinada para hosting y alquiler de dominio únicamente.

Bueno para el mundo, bueno para ti
Tanto si tienes tinnitus (acúfenos) cómo si no, un sonido ambiente (o ruido blanco) te ayuda a concentrarte durante la ejecución de tareas. Es bueno para todo el mundo. Y puedes disponer del proyecto desde cualquier lugar con solo una conexión a Internet.

No tengo ninguna experiencia en el crowdfunding. De hecho, del desenlace de este proyecto el planteamiento y desarrollo de los siguientes se hará acorde con el resultado de éste.

Si no puedes colaborar económicamente puedes hacerlo dando publicidad el proyecto usando las redes sociales y/o las herramientas de Indiegogo para que otros lo evalúen.

    Saludos y muchas gracias
